loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a woman who, throughout the years, has cultivated in herself and her children the honorable goal of work and self-improvement. She has undertaken several business activities that have helped her support her household. Currently Julia owns a small bodega (grocery and sundries store). She has seven children and still cares for four of them, who are still pursuing their studies. Her wish is to increase capital for setting up her business and to continue her work.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Doña Julia es una mujer que a lo largo de los años ha cultivado en ella misma y en sus hijos el noble deseo de trabajo y superación, ella ha emprendido diversos negocios que la ayudaron a sustentar su hogar y ahora cuenta con una pequeña bodega. Julia todavía tiene a su cargo a 4 de sus 7 hijos, quienes aun están estudiando, su deseo es incrementar su capital para implementar su pequeña tienda y continuar su trabajo

loans.use: Increase working capital

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Albatoul

texts.fr:
Mrs Albatoul B. is 46 years old and lives with her 4 children and husband in Kaboïla II, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After failing to succeed in several different types of businesses, she started a business of buying and selling heating wood and locally manufactured soaps twenty five (25) years ago. For the past six (6) years, she has been part of the Soro Yiriwaso credit program in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientele. After being given 4 group loans through an association of women from her district (Association BENKADI of KABOILA II), this is now her 4th individual loan. With this new loan, she intends to buy 2 truck loads of wood for heating and five (5) baskets of locally-manufactured soap from Sikasso and its surrounding towns (Tabarako, Missirikoro, etc.). She resells her goods for cash or credit from her residence to a clientele of mostly women. She plans to increase her monthly income to 75.000 FCFA which will be used to help her husband, to pay the interest on the loan and to reinvest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame Albatoul B. est agée de 46 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux à Kaboïla II, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Après avoir mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans reussite, elle décida de se consacrer finalement aux activités d’achat et vente de bois de chauffe et de savons de fabrication locale il y a maintenant vingt cinq (25) ans. Pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, elle decida de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis six (6) ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires au sein d’une association des femmes de son quartier (Association BENKADI de KABOILA II), elle est à son 4 ème prêt individuel. Elle compte acheter avec ce nouveau pret 2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe et cinq (5) paniers de savon de fabrication locale dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso (Tabarako, Missirikoro, etc.) mais aussi dans la ville de Sikasso. Elle revend ses marchandises en détails au comptant et à crédit à son domicile où elle mène cette activité à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui servira à aider son époux, à payer les intérêts de son prêt et investira le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of wood for heating and locally-made soap

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Soro Yiriwaso, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mrs Aminata N. is 33 years old and lives in a traditional widened family with her husband, his other wife and their children in Kapelekourou, one of the peripheral districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative area of the republic of Mali). For socioeconomic reasons (being from a nomadic fishermen's family known as "BOZO”) she did not go to school, but was interested very early on in the family activities of fishing and its by-products, which she learned and mastered from her mother. In order to obtain additional financial resources, she decided to join the credit program at Soro Yiriwaso 6 years ago. This is her 8th individual loan, and she has successfully reimbursed four other group loans with other women from her district (Association MOKO KELEN TESSEKOLA). With this loan, she plans to buy 400 kilogrammes of smoked fish in Mopti, otherwise known as “Malian Venice” (located in the 5th administrative area of the republic of Mali, in West Africa), still called “the city of the fish”, a town where she was born. Mrs. N. travels this road every month. She then re-sells her goods in bulk or individually for cash or credit to customers at the large market of Sikasso. With this loan, she plans to increase her monthly income by 150.000 FCFA, which she will then use to provide for her family's needs, to pay the interest on her loan, to pay for the transportation and reinvest the remainder in her business. She would like to become a wholesaler in order to provide for the smaller merchants who often have difficulty obtaining sufficient supplies.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Madame Aminata N. a 33 ans et vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Kapelekourou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Pour des raisons socio économoque ( issue d’une famille nomade de pêcheurs “BOZO”) elle n’a pas fréquentée l’école, mais très tot s’est interessée à l’activité familliale à savoir la peche et ses dérivés qu’elle a apprise et maitrisée auprès de sa mère. Pour obtenir des réssources financières complementaires elle decida de travailler avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant six (6) ans . Elle est à son 8 ieme prêt individuel après avoir bouclé 4 prêts solidaires au sein d’une association des femmes de son quartier (Association MOKO KELEN TESSEKOLA) Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 400 kilogrammes de Poissons fumé à Mopti “La vénise malienne” (la 5ème région administrative de la république du Mali, en Afrique de l’Ouest) encore appelée “La ville des poissons” qui est d’ailleurs sa ville natale .Elle effectue ce trajet chaque mois. Elle revend ses marchandises en gros et en détail au comptant et souvent à crédits aux client(e)s au grand marché de Sikasso où elle mène cette activité. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. qu’elle utilisera pour les dépenses de la famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt, payer le transport et investir le reste dans son activité. Elle souhaite devenir une grossiste afin de servir les détaillantes qui ont souvent du mal à s’approvionner facilement.

loans.use: Purchase of smoked fish

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Soro Yiriwaso, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Mr Kalifa T. is 27 years old, lives with his mother, brothers and sisters at his grandfather's house in Bougoula-Ville, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After the death of his father, Kalifa quickly had to give up his scholling and became an apprentice tailor in Sikasso and then in Bamako in order to help his mother take care of his younger siblings. Following a 6-year apprenticeship, he became a well-known master tailor in Sikasso with customers from all social classes. His workshop already has 2 machines, and is located at Bougoula-Ville, a very busy capital region of the third administrative area of Mali. In order to face the growing demands from his customers, he has decided to take part in the Soro Yiriwaso program, and this is his first individual loan. He would like to buy one (1) sewing machine in Bamako to supplement his existing equipment. With this machine he plans to increase his monthly income by 120.000 FCFA, with which he would like to further build workshop, to help with his family's needs and pay the interest on his loan. Mr. Traoré hopes to become a designer stylist of international reputation.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Monsieur Kalifa T. a 27 ans, vit avec sa maman, ses frères et soeurs chez son feu grand père à Bougoula-Ville, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali) Après le décès de son père, Kalifa abandonna vite l’école depuis l’enseignement fondamental pour faire l’apprenti tailleur à Sikasso puis à Bamako dans le souci de venir en aide à sa maman et à ses cadets. A la suite d’un apprentissage qui a duré 6 ans, il devient un maître tailleur brodeur connu de tout Sikasso avec une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories socio professionnelle. Son atélier de couture contenant déjà deux machines, est situé à Bougoula-Ville un quartier très populeux de la capitale de la troisième région administrative du Mali. Afin de faire face aux demandes de plus en plus croissantes et exigeantes de sa clientèle, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son 1er prêt individuel. Il compte acheter une (1) machine de Brodérie à Bamako pour compléter ses équipements. Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA.avec lequel il compte agrandir son atelier, faire face aux dépenses de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt. Monsieur Traoré espère devenir un styliste modeliste d’une réputation continentale.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Soro Yiriwaso, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Martina Rosario

texts.es:
Martina is very dedicated to her work. Her biggest concern always has been improving her financial condition. For this reason she opened a small shop in her own home. The shop provides the income she needs to support her 3 small, school-age children. They are the reason she works every day so that they can finish their studies. Martina’s wish is to increase the merchandise offered in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Martina es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, su anhelo ha sido siempre el de mejorar su situación económica, así que ella instaló en su propia casa una pequeña tienda la cual emplea para poder tener los ingresos que necesita para el sostén de sus hijos. Ella es madre de 3 pequeños que aún están en edad escolar, por ello se esfuerza cada día para que ellos culminen sus estudios. Su deseo es incrementar la mercadería de su tienda.

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is an enterprising woman who, over the years, has been an important source of financial stability for her family. She has provided for the needs of her children, who are now grown men and women. Maria continues her work alongsiD. her husband, who tirelessly provides her with support. Maria’s wish is to increase the merchandise she offers in her shop to better serve her clients. Please help Maria continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Doña María es una mujer emprendedora que con el paso D. los años ha sido parte importante en la estabilidad económica D. su familia, y así, sostener las necesidades D. sus hijos que ahora son hombres y mujeres D. bien. Ella sigue adelante con su trabajo al lado D. su esposo, quien la apoya incansablemente, su deseo es incrementar la mercadería D. su tienda, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Apoya a María a seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nancy Graciela

texts.es:
Nancy has worked many years to support her household. For 10 years she has been a street vendor selling food, usually in Vilcacoto, an area near her residence. Throughout all these years Nancy has been able to earn enough income to support her 4 children. She has set herself up to one day be able to sell groceries and, in doing so, remain closer to her children, especially the youngest ones. For now Nancy needs to buy ingredients to make the food she sells and replace the utensils she uses to serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Nancy ha trabajado durante varios años para ser un sostén de su hogar, hace 10 años ella vende comida de manera ambulante principalmente en Vilcacoto un lugar próximo a su localidad. Durante todos estos años, ella ha podio generarse los ingresos para sostener a sus 4 hijos. Se ha proyectado para que en un futuro cercano pueda vender también abarrotes y así estar más cerca de sus hijos, en especial de los más pequeños. Nancy necesita por ahora comprar ingredientes para sus comidas y mejorar los utensilios que utiliza para sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and utensils for business selling food

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mónica Tarcila

texts.es:
Monica is a woman who puts all her energy into her work and the wellbeing of her family. For this reason she took the brave and tough decision to earn income by making bricks. Monica has been doing this hard work for 4 years. Over this time she has seen her business grow significantly. Monica doesn’t want to stop and needs to continue purchasing raw materials for making bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Mónica es una mujer que pone toda su energía en el trabajo y por el bienestar de su familia. Para ello tomó la firme y valiente decisión de generar ingresos mediante la fabricación de ladrillos. Ella lleva ya 4 años con esta ardua labor y con el paso de los años ha visto crecer significativamente su negocio. Mónica no quiere detenerse y necesita seguir adquiriendo la materia prima para sus ladrillos.

loans.use: Increased capital for purchasing raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Since she was a small girl, Silvia has been entirely dedicated to work. She buys and sells cattle. Until now this has been the most important source of income for her. Her work consists of raising beef cattle and, after fattening them, she sells at the best price and makes her profit. In the future she wants to start another business. In the meantime she will continue dedicating herself to cattle raising. Right now she needs to improve the infrastructure of her stable to keep her animals in better condition.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia desde muy niña ha estado dedicada enteramente al trabajo, ella compra y vende ganado. Hasta ahora esa es la fuente de ingresos económico más importante para ella, su trabajo consiste en criar ganado vacuno y después de engordarlos los vende a mayor precio, de donde obtiene sus ganancias. En el futuro desea implementar otro negocio, mientras tanto seguirá dedicándose a la ganadería, ella necesita ahora mejorar la infraestructura de su establo para mantener en mejor estado a sus animales.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her stable for the animals she sells

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita is a courageous woman. She’s been doing arduous work in the fields for several years. This has allowed her to support her household and her children who are now good men and thankful to their mother. Juanita continues working for the good of her children and herself. In order to continue to cultivate beans and potatoes, that are the principle products of her imperious labor, she needs to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides. Support Juanita so she can continue working the land.

Translated by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita es una mujer valiente, ella lleva varios años de trabajo arduo en el campo. Esto le ha servido para ser el sostén de su hogar y de sus hijos que ahora son hombres de bien y agradecidos con su madre. Juanita continúa trabajando por el bienestar de sus hijos y por ella misma. Para continuar con el cultivo de habas y papa, que son los principales productos de su imperiosa labor, necesita comprar abono, semilla e insecticidas. Apoya a Juanita a seguir labrando la tierra.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mimsy Mayte

texts.es:
Mimsy is a young mother with a lot of desire to get ahead. She has a small daughter who is only two years old. Mimsy works principally with textiles and also makes delicious desserts. The knitting that she does is of very high quality and she fills numerous orders from her clients, the majority of whom are her own neighbors. She needs to buy wool at wholesale along with other materials for her knitting. Help Mimsy to continue to knit her future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Mimsy es una joven madre de familia con muchos deseos de superación, tiene una pequeña hija de tan solo 2 años. Mimsy trabaja realizando principalmente labores textiles y también deliciosos postres. Los tejidos que ella realiza son de muy alta calidad, atendiendo los numerosos pedidos de sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. Ella necesita comprar lana al por mayor y otros materiales para sus tejidos, ayuda a Mimsy a que siga tejiendo su futuro.

loans.use: Purchase textile related items for knitting

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Cipriana considers herself to be a very creative, active, and good-humored person. She has 4 grown-up children, none of whom live with her: Quintín Manuel (age 45, married); Martha Silvia (age 42, married); María Cristina (age 40, widowed); and María de la Luz (age 37, married).

She started the business because this activity is something that she likes to do. For her, making handicrafts is fun. Plus, it is something that she can do from home, which allows her to look after her grandchildren.

She started in March of 2006 thanks to a teacher who showed her how to make handicrafts. She started out making bags and bath coordinates. Then, she started making seasonal crafts such as flowers for the Day of the Dead, and floral arrangements for Christmas, St. Valentine’s Day, Children’s Day, Mother’s Day, etc. Thanks to her efforts, she has been prosperous because she sells the arrangements to her family, friends, and neighbors.

She needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which will be repaid in 4 months, so that she can purchase the supplies she needs in order to make her crafts and sell them to her customers. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cipriana se considera una persona muy creativa, activa y siempre de buen humor.Tiene 4 hijos: Quintín Manuel de 45 años, casado; Martha Silvia de 42 años, casada; María Cristina de 40 años, viuda y María de la Luz de 37 años, casada, ninguno vive con ella.

Inició el negocio porque es algo que le gusta hacer y le divierte hacer diferentes manualidades, además que es una actividad que realiza en casa lo que le permite cuidar a sus nietos.

Comenzó en Marzo de 2006, gracias a una maestra que le enseñó a elaborar las manualidades, primero comenzó haciendo bolsas y juegos de baño, después empezó a elaborar cosas de acuerdo a la temporada que se iba acercando como flores para el día de muertos, arreglos para la navidad, el día de la amistad, el día del niño, el día de las madres, etc. y gracias a su esfuerzo le ha ido muy bien ya que todos mis arreglos los vende entre familiares, vecinos y amistades.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando sus manualidades y poder venderlas entre sus clientes. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase craft supplies

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia is a very honest, responsible, and hardworking person with the desire to get ahead in life. As a single mother who did not have anyone’s support, she started the business because she needed the extra income in order to offer the best to her 2 children, Luis Abraham, an 18-year-old high school student, and Nadia Rubí, a 15-year-old middle school student. Thanks to her job cleaning houses, she earned the income needed to move her children forward and to purchase the tools and materials needed to make her crafts.

She started in February of 2006, thanks to an invitation she received for an arts and crafts course, in which she learned very quickly. Now, she can make different types of crafts, such as baskets, paper flowers, bath sets, and bags, among others, which she sells to her friends and employers.

She needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, in order to purchase the supplies she needs that will allow her to continue making her crafts to sell to her customers. With your help, Emilia will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.Inicio el negocio ante la necesidad de contar con otro ingreso para ofrecerle algo mejor a sus 2 hijos, Luis Abraham 18 años, estudiante de preparatoria y Nadia Rubí de 15 años estudiante de secundaria, ya que es madre soltera y no tenía el apoyo de nadie, gracias al trabajo que realizaba haciendo el aseo en casas donde la contrataban tuvo ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para comprar el material y las herramientas necesarias para elaborar sus manualidades.

Comenzó en Febrero de 2006, gracias a una invitación que recibío para asistir a un curso de manualidades en el cual aprendío muy pronto y en la actualidad puede realizar diversas manualidades como canastas, flores, juegos de baño, bolsas, etc. la cuales ofrece entre sus amistades y a la gente de las casas donde trabaja.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando mis manualidades y poder venderlas entre sus clientes.Con tu ayuda Emilia saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase craft supplies

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria is an innovative person who is always looking for a way to improve her business. She has 3 children: Carlos Jesús, a 22-year-old college student, Brenda Lizeth, a 14-year-old middle school student, and Juan David, an 8-year-old elementary school student.

Because she lacked a steady job that would allow her to earn an income, she decided to start a business. She has always liked to be a responsible person who wishes to give each of her children a college education so that they can have better opportunities in life.

She started back in March of 2002, selling tacos in front of her house. She later set up a space on the corner of her house, where she was able to arrange some tables and chairs for her customers’ comfort. Starting in July of 2005, she started making banquets for all occasions, and little by little, she was able to obtain china and flatware with the profits from the taco sales, thus offering a more complete service.

She needs a loan of $975.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the supplies she needs to make tacos and to purchase table cloths so that she does not have to rent them, thus increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una persona innovadora que siempre está viendo la forma de mejorar su negocio. Tiene 3 hijos: Carlos Jesús de 22 años estudiante universitario, Brenda Lizeth, 14 años, estudiante de secundaria y Juan David, de 8 años, estudiante de primaria.

Ante la falta de un empleo seguro y estable que le permitiera tener un ingreso decidio emprender su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona responsable y desea darles una carrera universitaria a cada uno de sus hijos para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.

Comenzó en Marzo de 2002, vendiendo taquitos en la parte de enfrente de su casa, posteriormente acondiciono un lugar en la esquina de su casa donde se pudo instalar mejor acomodando algunas mesas y sillas para que los clientes pudieran estar mas cómodos. A partir de Julio de 2005 comenzó a elaborar banquetes para todo tipo de fiestas y poco a poco fue adquiriendo loza y cubiertos con las ganancias que le dejaban la venta de tacos y de esta manera puedo dar un servicio mas completo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus tacos y poder comprar también manteles y no tener que rentarlos, de esta forma obtendra mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe started the business out of the desire to support her family and give her children a higher standard of living, besides the fact that she loves retail. She needed an income to help her family because she did not have a steady paycheck. She sometimes helped by cleaning other people’s houses, but that would cause her to neglect her family. For that reason, she looked for a job that would allow her to take care of her family while at the same time earn an income, two things she was able to obtain by setting up a taco stand. She started in February of 1998, when someone in her family suggested that she sell tacos since her husband and sister did that for a while. She talked it over with her husband and they decided to open a taco stand together, managing to get ahead. Additionally, she started selling footwear, and thanks to God, she has been prosperous.

She is requesting a loan of 300.00 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, in order to purchase the ingredients necessary to make tacos, which will help her increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe inició el negocio por el deseo de apoyar a su familia y darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos, además de que le gustan mucho las ventas. Ella necesitaba obtener un ingreso para ayudar a su familia ya que no contaba con un ingreso estable pues a veces ayudaba haciendo la limpieza en casas que le solicitaban pero descuidaba mucho a su familia, fue por eso que busco una actividad donde pudiera permanecer al cuidado de ellos y además obtener un ingreso, lo cual logro al poner su taquería. Comenzó en Febrero de 1998, cuando alguien de la familia le sugirió que vendiéra tacos ya que en un tiempo su esposo y una hermana de él se dedicaron a eso. Platico con su esposo y decidieron poner su taquería juntos, logrando salir adelante. Además, hace 2 años comenzó a vender calzado y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de tacos, lo cual le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tacos

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es:
María is a young woman with a desire to work. She lives with her mother whom she loves and cares for every day. Her mother worked indefatigably to sustain her and now María, as a grateful daughter, does that for her. She works independently embroidering cotton and linen fabrics and at other times as a conductress for a transportation company. Her young spirit allows her to dream big and she longs to become an important embroidery entrepreneur. In the meantime she continues to work with her hands doing what she enjoys the most. María needs to increase the production of her work and to buy a large quantity and variety of thread.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una joven mujer con ansias de trabajar, ella vive con su mamá a la que ama y cuida diariamente. Su madre se esforzó incansablemente para sostenerla y ahora María como una hija agradecida, vela por ella. Se desempeña trabajando independientemente en el bordado de fustanes y durante otros momentos como cobradora en una línea de transporte. Su espíritu joven la lleva a soñar en grande, pues uno de sus anhelos es llegar a ser una gran empresaria del bordado. Mientras tanto, sigue trabajando con sus manos en lo que más disfruta, María necesita mejorar la producción de sus prendas y comprar gran cantidad y variedad de hilos.

loans.use: Purchase materials for embroidery

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jesús Rolando

texts.es:
Jesús, a young father, works making bricks. His daily routine consists of getting up very early, making his way to the quarry and mixing each one of the products needed for the perfect preparation of mixture for the brick. His effort is constant in spite of the harshness of the weather and his courage is nourished by the love of his two children, knowing that they won’t lack anything. Jesús is requesting your help in order to invest in his brick factory and support his wife with her embroidery work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer. Jesús, joven padre de familia, se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Su rutina diaria consiste en levantarse muy de mañana, dirigirse a la cantera y mezclar cada uno de los insumos para la preparación perfecta de la mezcla para el ladrillo. Su esfuerzo es constante sin importarle las inclemencias del clima, esta valentía es alimentada por al amor de sus 2 hijos, para que a ellos no les falte nada. Jesús solicita su apoyo para invertir en su fábrica de ladrillos y apoyar a su esposa con su trabajo de bordados.

loans.use: Increase business capital for his brick factory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jesusa Natividad

texts.es:
Jesusa is very consistent and hardworking. It was more than 15 years ago when she made the dicision to create her own source of income and she did it by setting up a general store in her own home. Since then, that has been her family’s most important source of income and she dedicates herself to it tirelessly day after day.

Jesusa keeps in mind all the time that that the money is necessary in order for her children to continue studying. Her big dream is to increase the size of the store and to stock it with a greater number products in order make more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesusa es muy constante y trabajadora, hace ya más de 15 años que ella tomó la decisión de proporcionarse sus propias fuentes de ingreso, y lo hizo a través de una bodega que instaló en su propia casa. Desde entonces esa es la fuente de ingreso más importante para su familia, dedicándose a ello día tras día, sin descanso. Jesusa tiene en mente todo el tiempo que es necesario ese dinero para que sus hijos continúen estudiando. Su gran sueño es agrandar su tienda, surtirla con más productos y así obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Acquire new and better merchandise for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Urbano Héctor

texts.es:
Urbano is a hard-working man dedicated to watching out for the welfare of his family. He assumed this great responsibility by generating income doing farm work. He plants and cultivates tubers such as potatoes and varieties of grains and profits from their sale. This year, Urbano wants to improve his production record for each harvest in order to settle his home expenses and the expenses for his son’s studies. Collaborate with Urbano and together you can improve his production record.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Don Urbano es un hombre muy trabajador, dedicado a velar por el bienestar de su familia, esa gran responsabilidad la asumió generando ingresos en las tareas del campo. Siembra y cultiva tubérculos como la papa y otras variedades de granos, obteniendo ganancias con la venta de los mismos. Este año, Don Urbano desea superar su propio record de producción para cada cosecha, y así poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y los estudios del menor de sus hijos. Colabora con Urbano, y juntos podrán superar su record de producción.

loans.use: Capital to purchase farming supplies.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is married and has 2 children: Gonzalo, a 20-year-old who studies at the technical college in the city of Madero, and Lourdes, a 5-year-old preschool student. She started the business because she wished to help her husband with the household expenses and because she wanted to make her own money and become independent. In retail, she was able to find a pleasant way of life.

She started back in February of 2004, when a promoter invited her to help her sell shoes by catalogue. Since she was successful, she decided to become independent in April of 2006, thus being able to keep all her profits, not just a percentage.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 4 months, in order to purchase more merchandise and fill her customers’ orders. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es casada y tiene 2 hijos: Gonzalo de 20 años, estudia en el Tecnológico de Cd. Madero y Lourdes de 5 años estudiante de pre-primaria. Inició el negocio por el deseo de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y además tener un ingreso propio ya que le gusta ser independiente, y en las ventas encontro un estilo de vida de agradable.

Comenzó en Febrero de 2004, cuando una promotora la invitó a que le ayudara a vender zapatos por catalogo y como le empezó a ir bien decidío independizarse definitivamente en Abril de 2006 y así obtener el total de las ganancias y no solo un porcentaje.

Ella neecesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más mercancía y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (footwear)

loans.name: Nancy Rosa

texts.es:
Nancy sells clothing, and her target market is adults and children. She has now expanded to sell sheets and night clothing (e.g., pajamas, lingerie). All her products are sold in popular markets in the city of La Paz. She uses a system that allows her to sell on credit; this makes it easier to do daily and weekly collections.

She was married, but her marriage failed and left her with two children. She supports her children on her own because her former husband is incapable of giving a contribution and also because she wants to. Nancy lives in the area of Villa Harmony (La Paz) in her parents' home.

This is her first credit with Impro, but our analysis and the references from her friends (who are also our customers and would gladly help in the event that she is delinquent) allow us to fully trust her. In addition she is ambitious and will use the money to expand her range of trousers, quilts, linens, games, etc. That way, her children will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy vende ropa, su mercado son adultos y niños. Actualmente ha expandido sus actividades por lo que también comercializa sábanas y ropa de noche (pijamas, lencería). Todos sus productos son vendidos en los mercados populares de la ciudad de La Paz. Se vale de un sistema que le permite vender a crédito, esto le facilita hacer cobros diarios y semanales.

Estuvo casada pero su matrimonio fracasó y la dejó con dos hijos, los cuales ella mantiene sola por que el marido es incapaz de dar un aporte y tampoco desea hacerlo. Nancy vive en la zona de Villa Armonía (La Paz), en la casa de sus padres.

Este es su primer crédito en Impro pero nuestro análisis y las referencias dadas por sus amigas (que también son clientes nuestras y gustosamente la ayudarán en caso de estar ella en mora) nos permiten confiar plenamente en ella. Además ella es ambiciosa, usará el dinero para ampliar su oferta de pantalones, edredones, juegos de sábanas, etc. De esa manera sus hijos tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: For the sale of linens and clothing

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is a merchant who sells chicharrón (dried pork skin). She wanders the streets, as she does not have a permanent position. She is married and has five children. All of her children have their own businesses and expenses; they unfortunately cannot help their parents with their humble economic situation. Her home is located in the area Irpavi II, and she strives to pay rent without delay.

Irene is an enthusiastic person and consequently has access to credit. Moreover, this is the fifth time she is asking Impro for credit (and the second time with Kiva). The amount will be used to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Irene se dedica al comercio, venD. chicharrón D. cuero D. chancho seco (deambula por las calles ya que no tiene un puesto fijo), ella es casada, tiene 5 hijos (pero todos cuentan con negocios propios, tienen sus propios gastos y desafortunadamente no pueden ayudar a sus padres por su humilD. situación económica). Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. Irpavi II (se esfuerza por pagar los alquileres sin demorarse)

Irene es un persona entusiasta, por eso tuvo acceso al crédito, además, es la quinta vez que solicita crédito en Impro (en Kiva es la segunda). El monto será destinado para comprar mercadería.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for dried pork skin

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ivana Leonarda

texts.es:
Ivana makes blankets but weaves and braids them by hand. She takes orders by agreeing to the size and color desired by the customer. With regard to marital status, she is married; her husband is a construction worker but does not earn much. She has four children attending school.

Her home is located in the area Irpavi II of La Paz, but she does not own the land and serves as a caretaker. She must occupy a single room with her family (with the discomfort of many Bolivian families).

This is her fifth time seeking support from Impro and the third in which Kiva has given her their support. Ivana is very responsible. Despite having many expenses, she always pays her debts on time. The loan is intended for the purchase of raw materials (fabric).

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Ivana confecciona mantas pero las teje y trenza manualmente. Trabaja tomando pedidos, o sea, de acuerdo a la medida y color que requiere el cliente. En cuanto a su estado civil es casada (su esposo es albañil pero no gana mucho) y tiene 4 hijos que asisten a la escuela.

Su domicilio esta localizado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, pero el terreno no es de su propiedad por lo que ella hace de cuidadora y tiene que ocupar una sola habitación con su familia (incomodidad por la que pasan muchas familias bolivianas).

Esta es la quinta ocasión que solicita el apoyo de Impro y la tercera en la que Kiva le dará su apoyo. Ivana es muy responsable, a pesar de tener tantos gastos siempre paga a tiempo sus deudas. El crédito será destinado para la adquisición de materia prima (tela).

loans.use: For the purchase of fabric for blankets

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta makes wool blankets by hand through spinning and weaving. She has a husband who has a job in selling sand for cement manufacturing (which is considered poorly paid work in the construction sector). The address of the client in this Irpavi II (La Paz), but she is not the owner and thus serves as caretaker.

This is her fifth loan in Impro and her third in Kiva. Her rating is Customer I (Excellent). The loan will be used for working capital to purchase sheep leather, thread and wool.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Modesta elabora mantas D. vicuña, todo esto lo hace D. forma manual, es decir que tiene que hilar y luego tejer. Tiene un esposo que se dedica a arenero (un trabajo mal pagado en el ramo D. la construcción). El domicilio D. la clienta esta en Irpavi II (La Paz) pero ella no es la propietaria por lo que hace D. cuidadora.

Este es su quinto préstamo en Impro y el tercero en Kiva, su calificación es D. cliente I (excelente). El préstamo será destinado para capital D. trabajo (cuero D. oveja, hilos y lana).

loans.use: For purchasing sheep leather, thread, and wool

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana sells ladies’ leather jackets and wallets. Her husband is a mason contractor, and the couple has four children. The family lives in the area Irpavi II (La Paz) and pays rent because they do not own their own home.

This is the fourth time that she is applying for a loan in Impro and the third time that she is asking for the support of Kiva. Juliana is a person who complies with timely payments. This time, the loan will be used to expand her range of jackets, wallets and purses. It is because of her experience and credit history that she can access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Juliana se dedica a la venta de chamarras de cuero y carteras para dama, su esposo es albañil contratista, la pareja tiene 4 hijos. La familia vive en la zona de Irpavi II (La Paz), paga alquileres por que no tiene domicilio propio.

Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Juliana es una persona que cumple puntualmente con los pagos. Esta vez el crédito será para ampliar su oferta de chamarras, carteras y bolsones. Debido a su experiencia y antecedente crediticio es que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: For working capital to produce jackets and wallets

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita sells perfumes and cosmetics in all markets south of La Paz. She has a system that allows her to give credit to her customers and make charges daily and/or weekly. She is married and has a son who attends school.

The family lives in the area Irpavi II of La Paz. However, they have no home, so Margaret is forced to be the caretaker of the land they occupy in exchange for not paying rent.

This is her fifth credit with Impro and her third with Kiva. The client has a maximum score on compliance with a payment plan. The credit will be used to purchase goods in larger quantities (perfume, cosmetics, etc.) that may reduce her costs, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita vende perfumes y cosméticos en todos los mercados de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Dispone de un sistema que le permite otorgar crédito a sus clientes y poder hacer cobros diarios y/o semanales. Ella esta casada y tiene un hijo que asiste al colegio.

La familia vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, no obstante no cuentan con domicilio propio, por lo que Margarita se ve forzada a ser cuidadora del terreno que ocupa a cambio de no pagar alquileres.

Este es quinto crédito en Impro y el tercero en Kiva. La clienta tiene una puntuación máxima en cuanto a cumplimiento de plan de pagos. El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería en mayor cantidad (perfumes, cosméticos, etc), así podrá reducir sus costos, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: For working capital to purchase perfume and cosmetics

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria is a shopkeeper selling clothing as well as articles for the home. Her husband is employed and they have three children.

Her home is in the Irpavi II district of La Paz. The family has their own home, but there is no sewer system available.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan from Impro and the second time she has needed support from Kiva. Her hard work and self-improvement make her credit-worthy. With this loan she will increase the range of products offered, improving her income and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Maria es comerciante, venD. tanto ropa como artículos para el hogar, su esposo es empleado y tiene 3 hijos.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Irpavi II D. la ciudad D. La Paz. La familia tiene casa propia pero aún no cuenta con servicio D. alcantarillado .

Es la es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la segunda que requiere el apoyo D. Kiva.

Su trabajo y las ganas D. superación le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que con este préstamo incrementará su gama D. productos, mejoraran sus ingresos y por enD. su calidad D. vida.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Betty Santusa

texts.es:
Betty sells coca leaves in markets. The purchasers use the coca to make tea with medicinal properties, such as headache relief. Construction workers chew the coca leaves for more stamina while working.

Betty is married, her husband is a salaried driver. Because he does not own his own car and works for an employer, he does not have the earnings of an independent driver.

The couple lives in the Irpavi II district of La Paz, in a place where the rent is high. This is the third time Betty has requested a loan, and the second time she has needed support from Kiva. Her history of efficient payment of her installments qualifies her as a #1 client.

The loan would be for the purchase of a larger quantity of merchandise. (She has proven that she is not involved in any illicit activity related to narcotics trafficking.)

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Betty se dedica a la venta de hojas de coca, las cuales son vendidas en mercados (los compradores usan la coca para hacer té, con propósitos medicinales –combatir el dolor de cabeza por ejemplo-) y en las construcciones (los albañiles mascan las hojas de cocan para tener mayor resistencia en el trabajo).

Betty es casada, su esposo es chofer asalariado por lo que no cuenta con un automóvil propio, por lo tanto, tiene un patrón y no gana lo que un chofer independiente.

La pareja vive en la zona Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, en un lugar donde pagan un alquiler caro.

Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente 1, es decir que cumple eficientemente con el pago de sus cuotas.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería (por si acaso, se ha comprobado que no esta involucrada en actividades ilícitas relacionadas con el narco tráfico).

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory

loans.name: Berta

texts.en: Berta is a member of the Village Bank Tarpuy. She is 54 years old, married, and has 7 children ranging in age from 15 to 33 years old. She uses her loans from FINCA toward her business of selling fish in the Nery García market. She goes to Lima once every week, Thursday to Saturday, to buy the fish that she sells at the market in Ayacucho. Berta needs a loan to invest in the growth of her business and buy more fish. Berta dreams that her business will grow with the help of the loans from FINCA, and that she will be successful.

loans.use: To invest in the growth of her business and to buy more fish.

loans.name: Berta's Group

texts.en:
Berta and Rufilia are members of the Village Bank Tarpuy, which means "Sowing" in Quechua. Berta lives with her partner/boyfriend, is 44 years old and has 4 children. Berta travels to the different fairs of the region twice per week where she buys cereals, which she stores and then sells in November when the prices have risen.

Rufilia is married, 37 years old, and has 5 children. Rufilia buys cochineal, tara, and leather from a stand at the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho, and then sells them to middlemen who take the products to Lima.

Berta and Rufilia need a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, kiwicha, tara, cochineal, and leather. The dreams of Berta and Rufilia are that their children finish their studies, and that they have secure jobs and capital to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, barley, kiwicha (cereal), tara (dye derived from a plant), cochineal (dye derived from an insect), and leather.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Village Bank Tarpuy. She is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 9, 16, and 20. Hermelinda uses her money from FINCA towards her business of selling haberdashery – which includes buttons, threads, ribbons, drapery, etc. She sells these things to people in the countrysiD.. Hermelinda started this business with her husband 15 years ago, but now she operates it alone, and has a business of selling hats with her husband. Hermelinda's dream is to have more money and succeed in her business, and also that her children become professionals.

Julia is a member of the Village Bank Tarpuy. She is 62 years old, widowed, and has 7 children ranging in age from 17 to 38 years old. Julia has a business of selling different types of bread from her house – she has a small sort of bakery in her home. She has been doing this business for 24 years, and says it has become much better in the last 2 years. Julia's dream is that her children will all have good educations and be successful – she is working to help them do this.

Hermelinda and Julia are asking for a loan to increase their businesses. Hermelinda will use the money to buy more haberdashery, and Julia to buy flour, butter, firewood, and other things to use in her bakery.

loans.use: To increase their haberdashery and bakery businesses.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia loves music. She always proved to be an enterprising and talented woman with innumerable projects. Since she had her daughter, Magneth, she has worked in different businesses such as the sale of cosmetics, sale of meat and now with some family members and friends she has decided to acquire musical instruments to form her own orchestra. What she has in mind is to work hard and get ahead with her small daughter who, every day gives her the strength to continue. Delia needs to acquire some musical instruments to finish setting up her orchestra.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Delia es amante de la música, ella siempre demostró ser una mujer emprendedora y muy talentosa, con innumerables proyectos para su vida, desde que trajo al mundo a su pequeña niña, Magneth, ha trabajado en diferentes actividades tales como venta de cosméticos, de carne y ahora en sociedad con algunos familiares y amigos decidió adquirir instrumentos musicales y formar su propia orquesta. Ella sólo tiene en mente esforzarse y salir adelante con su pequeña niña, quien día a día le da las fuerzas suficientes para continuar. Delia requiere adquirir algunos instrumentos musicales y terminar de implementar su orquesta.

loans.use: Purchase of musical instruments to set up orchestra.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: José Pelayo

texts.es:
Jose comes from a humble family but with a great desire to look for a better life. Because of lack of money he could not study a professional career but did not lose the hope that one day he will realize this dream. Because of this, Jose decided to work full time as a security guard for a company. In addition to his noble and risky profession, Jose and his loving mother have a small grocery store and thanks to this store they are improving their economic condition. Because of the great quantity of requests and suggestion they receive from their clients they are in need of additional capital to invest in increasing their merchandise so they can offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

José proviene de una familia humilde, pero con inmensas ganas de buscar una mejor condición de vida. Por la falta de dinero no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero no pierde las esperanzas de que algún día pueda alcanzar este sueño. Para ello, José decidió trabajar a tiempo completo como personal de seguridad en una importante empresa de su localidad. Adicionalmente a su noble y arriesgado oficio, José y su querida madre poseen una bodeguita de abarrotes y gracias a ello están mejorando su condición económica. Pero por la gran cantidad de solicitudes y sugerencias que reciben de sus clientes se ven en la necesidad de contar con mayor capital de inversión para incrementar su mercadería y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria is a charismatic woman and loved in her community. About 8 months ago she decided to open a dental office. In this small but welcoming space she daily attends to numerous patients, patients that leave very satisfied by the good service that they receive. Gloria, in the course of time, wants to expand her office so that she can offer working opportunities for young people in her profession. Your loan will allow Gloria’s project to become a reality, and be an important expansion of this necessary service for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es una mujer muy carismática y querida en su localidad, hace aproximadamente 8 meses con apoyo de su esposo decidió abrir un consultorio dental, en ese pequeño pero acogedor local atiende diariamente a gran cantidad de pacientes, pacientes que quedan muy satisfechos por el buen servicio que reciben. Gloria, con el transcurso del tiempo tiene en mente ampliar su consultorio y así ofrecer nuevas oportunidades de trabajo a jóvenes egresados de su rama profesional. Vuestro aporte permitirá concretar los proyectos de Gloria, y ser parte importante de la ampliación de este servicio tan necesario para todos.

loans.use: Expansion of dental office.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Livestock And Crafts Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoan Thi D. is 43 years old. She is currently living with her husband and two children. She and her husband weave flower baskets to sell to florists. Besides that she also raises livestock to supplement the family’s income. The family’s average income is about 80,000 VND per day. She likes the method of gradual loan repayment, so she always wished to participate in the Fund. She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in raising livestock and weaving.
  • Her group includes:
  • Mrs. Lieu Thi H. is 48 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in livestock.
  • Mrs. Thu Thi T. is 30 years old. She is requesting 3.360.000 VND to invest in raising livestock.
  • Mrs. Thuong Thi H. is 52 years old. She is requesting 3.360.000 VND to buy materials to make fans and brooms.
  • Mrs. Hoa Thi N. is 40 years old. She is requesting 3.360.000 VND to invest in livestock.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Đỗ Thị Hoán (MS: 030001), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con. Cô và chồng thường ngày đan các giỏ hoa để bán cho các của hàng buôn hoa. Ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô là80.000 VND/ngày. Cô rất thích với việc trả dần vốn vay, vì vậy cô luôn mong muốn được tham gia vay vốn chương trình. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi và đan lát.

  • Trong nhóm còn có:
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Liễu (MS: 030003), năm nay 48 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Chị Trần Thị Thu (MS: 030004), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Thường (MS: 030005), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu làm quạt, chổi.
  • Cô Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 030007), năm nay 40 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Nhóm đã đăng nhưng bi issue, ID cũ của nhóm là 53978).

loans.use: Livestock and weaving

loans.name: Livestock And Small Businesses Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoa Thi D. is 49 years old. She has a reputation for being a trustworthy person in her village and is admired by everyone. Her famiL. owns a small store which brings in a regular income. The famiL.’s main occupation is farming. She has two small children, one of which is still in school; her older child is working and has an average income of 50,000 VND per month. She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in expanding the famiL. store.
  • Her group includes:
  • Mrs. Muoi Thi T. is 59 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in a small business.
  • Mrs. The Thi H. is 25 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to raise pigs.
  • Mrs. Duyen Thi T. is 49 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in a small business.
  • Mrs. Thuy Bich L. is 46 years old. She is requesting 3,360,000 VND invest in raising livestock.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Đậu Thị Hoa (MS: 080002), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô là người có uy tín trong làng và được mọi người yêu mến. Gia đình cô có cửa hàng nhỏ, tạo thu nhập thường xuyên. Nghề chính của gia đình cô là làm nông nghiệp. Cô có hai con, một con đang còn đang đi học, con lớn đi làm có thu nhập bình quân 50.000 VND/ tháng. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư mở rộng của hàng.

  • Trong nhóm cô gồm có:
  • Trịnh Thị Mười (MS: 080003), năm nay 59 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Chị Hoàng Thị The (MS: 080004), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND để nuôi lợn.
  • Cô Tạ Thị Duyên (MS: 080013), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Cô Lý Bích Thủy (MS: 080014), năm nay 46 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Nhóm cô đã đăng nhưng bị issue, ID cũ của nhóm là 53976).

loans.use: Small business and raising livestock

loans.name: Salwanah

texts.id:
Salwanah a divorcee with three children has to work hard to survive. Therefore after being left by her husband who remarried 15 years ago, Salwanah started to open the meatball sales business. With an initial capital of Rp 200,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00), Salwanah bought beef, that was then ground at the market's grinder; afterwards the meat was mixed with spices and a little flour, then round rolled to the size of quail's eggs, then cooked in boild water that was already mixed with spices so that it would taste good as soup. It is then served in a bowl mixed with noodles, cabbage, soy sauce and a little other sauces. From this meatball sales, usually a profit of Rp45,000/day could be achieved. This profit is used by Salwanah to pay for daily expeneses. The house she lives is inherited from Salwanah parents. For the future, Salwanah likes to expand her business by selling mixed rice and light food, besides selling meatballs, her old business. Therefor Salwanah requested the loan to Dinari Foundation for Rp 500,000. Salwanah hopes her new venture would succeed, and obtained profit increased.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Salwanah seorang janda beranak tiga harus berjuang keras untuk bisa bertahan hidup,Oleh karena itu semenjak ditinggal menikah lagi oleh suaminya 15 tahun yang lalu Salwanah mulai membuka usaha berjualan Bakso.Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.200.000 Salwanah membeli daging sapi,kemudian daging tersebut digiling pada penggilingan daging di pasar,setelah itu daging diberi bumbu dan sedikit tepung kanji,barulah dibuat adonan bulat-bulat sebesar telur burung puyuh,dan direbus dalam air mendidih yang juga sudah diberi bumbu biar terasa sedap sebagai kuahnya. Untuk menghidangkan dalam mangkok biasanya dicampur dengan mi, kol ,kecap juga sedikit saos. Dari penjualan bakso ini biasanya diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.45.000 perhari. Keuntungan inilah dipakai oleh Salwanah untuk biaya hidup setiap hari. Sedangkan rumah yang ditempatinya sekarng merupakan warisan dari orang tua Salwanah. Untuk kedepannya Salwanah ingin mengembangkan usahanya dengan berjualan nasi campur beserta makanan ringan ,disamping berjualan bakso sebagai usaha yang sudah lama ditekuninya.Oleh sebab itu Salwanah mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari sebesar Rp.500.000, Salwanah berharap usahanya ini bisa berhasil dan keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To add business capital to open extension business of mixed rice sales (Menambah modal usaha untuk membuka usaha tambahan yaitu menjual nasi campur)

loans.name: Burneebat

texts.mn:
Business Description
Mr. Burneebat is forty nine years old, happily married, and has three healthy children.  In 1990 Mr. Burneebat began making clothing and hats out of his home in Ulaanbaatar.  Once his business generated enough profit Mr. Burneebat purchased a working room in the center of the city.  This is Burneebat’s sixth loan with XacBank.  He has a perfect repayment history spanning 1,212 days.  The loan will be used to meet growing demand for wool felt hats made by Mr. Burneebat and his wife.

Бизнесийн тодорхойлолт 
Иргэн Бүрнээбат нь 49 настай, эхнэр 3 хүүхэтэй. Бүрнээбат нь 1990 оноос Улаанбаатар дахь өөрийн гэртээ хувцас болон малгай хийж эхэлсэн. Бүрнээбат бизнесийн ашгаараа Улаанбаатар хотын төвд ажлын өрөө худалдан авсан. Энэ удаагийн зээл нь ХасБанкнаас 6 дахь удаагаа авч байгаа зээл юм. Түүний зээлийн түүх нь маш сайн бөгөөд Банктай 1,212 өдөр харилцжээ. Энэхүү зээл нь Бүрнээбат болон түүний эхнэрийн гараар урлагддаг ноосон малгайны үйлдвэрлэлд зарцуулагдах болно.

loans.use:
Loan Description
Mr. Burneebat requests a micro loan for 1,200,000 MNT to purchase raw materials.  The loan will go towards buying processed sheep’s wool to use in the production of clothing and hats.


Зээлийн тодорхойлолт 
Ирэн Бүрнээбат нь 1,200,000 төгрөгийн бичил зээлийг түүхий эд худалдан авахдаа зориулан хүссэн.  Зээлээр хонины ноос худалдан авч хувцас болон малгай хийнэ.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru:
Abdurahim is 36, married, and has 3 children. He has been involved in business for several years. He now has two area of business - at home he raises cattle, and in addition, since he is a chef by training, he rents a small cafe, where he cooks and has hired employees. At his cafe customers can sit with friends, enjoy a good lunch, and drink cold beer and other refreshing drinks. Both businesses are stable and allow him to support his family. Since he invested a large amount of money in the cafe, he came to Microinvest for a loan. With the loan he bought two large bull calves. His family helps raise the animals. Business grew steadily and he earned a good profit. When he found out about Kiva, he decided to request a new loan, which he would like to invest into expanding the livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахиму 36 лет, женат. имеет 3 детей. Предпринимательством занимается уже несколько лет. Сейчас у него 2 направления бизнеса - дома откармливает крупный рогатый скот и еще, так как он по профессии повар, он взял в аренду маленькое кафе где наняв работников работает по профессии. Там у него можно вкусно пообедать, выпить холодного пива и прохладительные напитки, посидеть с друзьями. Оба бизнеса стабильные и позволяют содержать семью. Так как большая часть денег была вложена им в кафе, он обратился в Микроинвест за займом. Получив займ он купил 2 больших бычков. В откорме скота ему помогает его семья. Бизнес развивался стабильно и он тогда получил хорошую прибыль. Узнав О КИВА он решил обратиться за новым займом. который собирается вложить в дальнейшее расширение откорма скота.

loans.use: Purchase of bull calves

loans.name: Masuma

texts.ru:
Masuma is a businesswoman with 2 years of experience. She is 33 years old and has two children. Three years ago tragedy struck - after a long illness her husband passed away. Left with two children Masuma had no idea how to move forward. Little work is available in the area where she lives, so with the help of her older sister she decided to start a business. Using her savings and aided by her sister, she rented a small place at the bazar, and started buying and selling children's clothing. What money she made became the only source of income for the family. She lives with her mother-in-law. The children are growing and she needs to be selling at the bazar every day. She has been involved with Microinvest for over a year. She has been an exemplary client during this time. Now the summer clothing season is approaching, and Masuma would like a new loan to expand her selection of summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Масумахон предприниматель с 2-х летним стажем. Ей 33 года, у нее 2 детей. 3 года назад у нее случилось несчастье. После продолжительной болезни у нее умер муж. Оставшись с двумя детьми Масумахон не знала что делать дальше. Особой работы в районе ее проживания не было и она при помощи старшей сестры решила начать заниматься бизнесом. На свои сбережения и с помощью сестры она арендовала маленькое место на базаре, стала заниматься куплей продажей детской одежды. Получаемый доход стал основным в ее семейном бюджете. Проживает она со своей свекровью. Дети растут и она вынуждена быть каждый день на базаре и торговать. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает больше года. За это времы показала себя образцовой клиенткой. Сейчас наступает сезон летней одежды и Масумахон обратилась за новым займом для пополнения ассортимента летней одежды.

loans.use: To expand the summer clothing selection

loans.name: Mukaddamhon

texts.ru:
Mukaddamhon is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her husband works in Russia and sends money back to support the family. In addition, Mukaddamhon works at the bazar, where she buys and sells dried fruit; apricots, apples, and prunes in particular. She has six years of experience in this business. She has been involved with Microinvest for three years, and her loans have allowed her to significantly expand her business. She has always paid back loans on time and without trouble. Now is a time of low dried fruit prices so Mukaddamhon is actively buying them from the area's markets. In order to increase her operating capital, she decided to ask Kiva for a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Мукаддамхон 34 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж в России на заработках, присылает деньги для содержания семьи. Кроме этого Мукаддамхон выходит на базар, где занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов. Опыт в этой деятельности у нее 6 лет. Ассортимент сухофруктов составляет абрикосы, яблоки и слива. С Микроинвест сотрудничает уже 3 года и с помощью займов Мукаддамхон значительно раширила свой бизнес. Все погашения займа производила вовремя и без проблем. Сейчас сезон низких цен на сухофрукты и поэтому Мукаддамхон активно скупает их на рынках по району. Для пополнения своего оборотного капитала она решила обратиться в КИВУ за новым займом.

loans.use: To increase operating capital

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar I. is a 54 year old man who keeps food store in his store. He has lived and worked in the Saatli Region since 1998. He is married and has 2 daughters.

This store is the one and only financial source of income for his family. Therefore, Etibar tries very hard to attract as many clients as possible. In the summer time, the most popular products are cool beverages. However, Etibar does not have them in his store. Thus, he is worried that he could lose a significant number of clients. To improve this situation, he has applied for a $1200 USD loan that he will use to to purchase a refrigerator and beverages to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and beverages

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub I. is a 51 year old trader who keeps his store in a small village. He has lived and worked in the Saatli Region since 1990. Teyyub is married and has 3 children.

The store is his main source of income. Teyyub has thus applied for a $1000 USD loan in order to diversify and purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To diversify and purchase more inventory

loans.name: Mayas Kakchiquel Group

texts.en:
The Women from the Maya Kakchiquel group live in San Andres, a small, rural village in the mountains above Lake Atitlan. They enjoy living in such a town because of its tranquility and low amounts of crime, according to Maria C.. They expressed contentment with their specific loan group because of the support that the women can provide each other in a friendly atmosphere.

They are mostly mothers who manage to proudly send their children to school, even while managing and investing in the needs of their micro-enterprises. Seven of the group members are dedicated to hand weaving traditional indigenous clothing, another four, to the resale of imported second hand clothing, and another three to the sale and production of food products.

Hand-made guipils traditional top blouses of the high quality that they accustom to sell, usually take one month to produce and sell for amounts between 150 to 220 USD, according to Silvia S.. The resale of clothing is managed by shopping at different used sales stores, finding valuable items, and selling them once more in their town and local, to people interested, hereby gaining a profit. The food producers focus on a series of vegetables, produce and either sell to middlemen or directly at town markets.

When asked about how their businesses were going, there was hesitation, but overall, they were content with the rate of growth and income that it had brought them. This was said, despite their recognition that the price of many things has gone up recently and sales drop for the rainy season.

Nevertheless, these mothers and businesswomen were proud to have their own business which allowed them a sense of empowerment. With the capability to reinvest their money and return higher profits, this struggle is made easier, according to Rosa M., and their work can carry on while they are “satisfied and tranquil.”

Most of the loan that they receive goes to bulk purchasing of the necessary products for their business, be it cloth, threads and dyes for the weavers, or seed, fertilizer and pesticide for the farmers. They continuously need this useful capital to allow them flexibility paying off debts, expanding their business while reinvestment, and living a comfortable life as a family.

Karla C. sells “Ostra” mushrooms in a home-made wooden house specifically to foster mushroom growth. Her mushrooms are sold in the villages at lower altitudes down by Lake Atitlan. Her business, as well as many others of her group partners, has grown, yet she could still use this loan to make it grow even further. She said she would invest the money from loans in building a large greenhouse to produce much more mushrooms at once. Ingrid D. said she would remodel her local store with loan money to attract more customers.

Their dreams with ideal loan sizes only go so far into what it is that makes them perform the way they do. Deep inside, each of these women truly wanted the best for their family (like providing our “kids with education until they have a title” a HS equivalent), to show that they were independent and could actually help out their husbands, while improving their overall living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, thread, dyes / second hand clothing / Investment in a large greenhouse and in bulk pesticides, seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ibadet

texts.en:
Ibadet J. is a 48 year old man who sells fruits and vegetables in the open air. He lives with his family in a small village in the Imishli Region. He currently works at a washing station and washes cars. It is very hard and low paid work.

Therefore, Ibadet is now more focused on his permanent and main income – his store. To develop his business, he applied for a loan of $1200 USD. With this loan, he will purchase more goods and will improve his working conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and improve his working conditions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of pants and shirts to restock a small business.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is 51years old and a mother of two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Djabrayil region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She is now living and working in the Absheron region, Binegedi Shosse.

Solmaz has been in the retail business for ten years and now needs a loan of $875 to purchase more products to supply her customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To bulk-buy women's clothing to keep operating a small business.

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en:
Mazakhir is 59 years old and the father of 3 children. As an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Kalbadjar region, he and his family are now settled in the Surakhani region.

Mazakhir started his retail business 10 years ago. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy food products to augment his inventory and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy food products to expand inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in a large quantity of materials to start a cabinet making business.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is 45 years old, married and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Zangilan region, and is now living in the Gala settlement.

Nariman has been in the clothing sales business for 8 years and now needs a loan of $625 to buy more clothes to increase his inventory and expand his sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn C. lives in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where he in the business of house construction, while his wife, Mrs. Han Hean, is a subsistence farmer. Mr. Thorn C.’s family currently lives in poor conditions because he and his wife can generate only a small income. Thus, he is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

Mr. Thorn C. is 45 and the father of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the three others are attending the local school. Previously, he obtained a loan from AMK to add with his savings to buy a cart for transporting fertilizers to the field.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Mrs. Muth M., a Khmer noodle seller in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is a 44-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Although the family has only two members, they still live in poor conditions. Thus Mrs. Muth M. is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice as well as pigs to start a breeding business. Previously, Mrs. Muth M. obtained $125 from AMK to buy rice to keep in stock to sell later at a better price.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice as well as pigs to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon Y., a 34-year-old widow, lives in Kraing Sromo Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she operates a restaurant business and sells Khmer noodles in the village. As well, Mrs. Mon Y. is both a subsistence farmer and pig breeder. She has three children, one of whom is a Khmer cake seller while the others assist her on the rice plantation. She would now like to expand her income, so she is seeking a loan to buy a piece of land in order to cultivate rice and to  purchase more pigs. Previously, Mrs. Mon Y. obtained $125 from AMK to buy four piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for rice cultivation as well as more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: March

texts.en: Mrs. March K. is a farmer who lives in Chrork Sangkai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Tip Sun, is a house construction worker and they have four children, one of whom is attending school while the others are of preschool age. The family lives in poor conditions in a very old house, so in order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. March K. is requesting a loan to combine with her savings  to build a new house to replace the old one. Previously, she obtained $150 from AMK to buy household equipment to use in daily life.

loans.use: To help build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
Mrs. Poy D., 44, lives in Kraing Sromo Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she is a dessert-seller and farmer. Her farming earns only a small revenue because she owns only a small field. To increase her income, she is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land upon which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ol Eth, rents loudspeakers to villagers for their parties and ceremonies.

Mrs. Poy D. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a dessert-seller while another is a subsistence farmer. The remaining one is attending the local school. Previously, Mrs. Poy D. obtained a loan to buy loudspeakers for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en:
Elmaddin (his sister is pictured) is 29 years old and single. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region of the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now living and working in the Mardakan settlement and has been selling phone accessories for 4 years.

Elmaddin needs a loan of $1200 to buy more telephone accessories to increase his inventory and supply his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Thy Yeav

texts.en: Mr. Thy Y., a villager in Rolaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, is currently in the plantation business. His wife, Mrs. Muoy Seng, is a vegetable farmer. Their revenue is  small because they own a small field; thus, Mr. Thy Y. is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land in order to expand their earnings.  Mr. Thy Y. has three children, all of whom are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in order to expand his and his wife's revenue.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyneang C. is a 26-year-old widow in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a taxi driver who transports customers from Kampong Chhnang to Phnom Penh and back. Despite owning a car, she finds it difficult to travel around the village to shop or take her children to school since the roads are not suitable for automobiles. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike. Previously, Mrs. Sreyneang C.  obtained a loan that, added to her savings, allowed her to purchase a car to start her current business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ludev
