M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MARIA GRACIA”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia Moyobamba y distrito Moyobamba, se dedica a las manualidades su negocio esta ubicada en su misma casa en el Jr. Libertad Nro 733 donde diariamente acuden su clientes La señora es de profesión Profesora pero al tener dificultad para encontrar trabajo opto por iniciarse en el mundo del negocio de las manualidades ya que contaba con el apoyo de su esposo y gracias a sus esfuerzos y al préstamo recibido logró implementar su negocio ya que sus pedido incrementaron debido a la calidad de su trabajo. Con este préstamo de S/.2,300.00 el cual será devuelto en 6 meses, compró telas propias para este tipo de acabados , hilos, cintas de distintos colores, lentejuelas, agujas de diferentes tamaños y grosor y así dar la atención que se merecen sus clientes . La señora Carmen Rosa vive con su mamá y sus hijos, trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida con muchas perspectivas en el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making handicraft products

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Mrs Filomena C. A. is a very loving and determined woman. She is 43 years old, has two children, and lives in the Rioja district.

Filomena is a member of Santo Cristo De Bagazan Community Bank and runs a catering business selling prepared food dishes from a stand near the Nuevo Rioja Health Centre, whose employees are her main customers. Using her experience in preparation of several food dishes and her ability to spot an opportunity, she began her business to earn an income and to support her husband with family expenses. She aspires to own a restaurant.

With this loan, repayable over four months, Filomena plans to buy various ingredients in bulk such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, condiments, and chicken, for convenience as well as to guard against rising price.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Filomena C. A., es socia del BANCO COMUNAL ”SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN”, vive en el departamento y provincia de Rioja distrito de Rioja se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida ambulatoria gran cantidad de sus clientes son los trabajadores del centro de salud de Nuevo Rioja. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio, la impulsaron a iniciarse en este negocio, para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, ella implementará su negocio, pues compró insumos como arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, aceite a granel , condimentos y gallinas en cantidad para preparar sus juanes ya que le es mas cómodo comprar en cantidad , en vista de que no hay estabilidad en los precios de los productos La señora Filomena tiene 43 años es una mujer muy amorosa y decidida, tiene dos hijos vive con su pareja y sueña con tener un Restaurante.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Mrs Flor is 36 years old, lives in San Martin region, Rioja district and is a member of La Mujer Riojanita Community bank.

Flor is a nurse by training but has never practiced her profession, preferring the world of business. She started a business selling clothes. But unfortunately it was not sufficiently profitable. While considering a change of business, she stumbled upon the idea of pig farming and has never looked back since. Thanks to her sales and husbandry efforts, she has grown her business and has many loyal and grateful customers.

With this loan, repayable over six months, she plans to buy maize, soya beans, and dried pig meat, all necessary to feed the pigs.

Flor is an enterprising woman and has shown that with effort and dedication there is no limit to success and in achieving one’s goals.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA MUJER RIOJANITA,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Rioja y distrito rioja, en el Jr: Angaisa Nº 1160 se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos su criadero esta ubicado en el sector democracia. Sus principales clientes son los moradores de la ciudad. La señora es de profesión Técnica en Enfermería el cual nunca pudo ejercer, ella se siente mejor en el mundo del negocio empezó vendiendo ropa el cual vio que no era rentable y cambio de actividad, no tuvo mejor idea que iniciarse en el negocio de la crianza y venta cerdos Gracias al esfuerzo propio ha logrado incrementar su negocio, habiendo ganado el aprecio y la acogida de una gran clientela. Con el crédito de S/.2,700.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará polvillo, maíz soya, porcina en sacos ya que este alimento es necesario para la crianza de cerdos. La señora Flor tiene 36 años, trabaja diariamente, demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una boutique.

loans.use: Purchase of pig feed in bulk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Mrs Hilda is a partner in the Communal Bank "The Springtime", and live sin the department of San Martin, in the province and district of Moyabamba. Her activity is to raise and sell pigs, the same that are sold live and by weight in kilos. Her farm is located in her house in the AA. HH. La primavera Mz E Lt 7

She began this business thanks to the perseverance of her Mother who longed for her daughter move forward and not be frustrated by being a single mother despite the lack of economic support from the father of her children for food and education needs. With the thanks of God everything is going well and she is proud.

With this loan of S/700.00 ($250.00), to be repaid in 4 months, she would purchase rice, ground corn and bags of salt, rope to transport animals as she needs to bring them outside of the city in order to sell them.

She is 30 years old, has three children, and thanks to this activity is able to provide education and push her children forward and contribute to the expenses of her family. She is always characterized as being strong and a fighter.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “LA PRIMAVERA”, vive en el Departamento San Martín, Provincia de Moyabamba y Distrito de Moyabamba tiene por actividad la crianza y venta de cerdos, los mismos que vende vivos y por kilos. Su criadero se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa en el AA. HH. La primavera Mz E Lt 7. Se inicio en el negocio gracias a la perseverancia de su Mamá de querer que su hija salga a delante y no se frustre por ser madre soltera ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos tanto en la alimentación y educación, agradece a DIOS porque le va muy bien de las cuales se siente orgullosa. Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00, que será pagado en 4 meses comprará: polvillo de arroz , maíz molido y sal por sacos, sogas para el traslado de dichos animales ya que ella los tiene que comprar fuera de la ciudad. Tiene 30 años de edad, 03 hijos , siente que gracias a esta actividad podrá educar y sacar adelante a sus hijos y contribuir con los gastos de su familia siempre se caracterizó por ser fuerte y luchadora.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of feed for pigs. Purchasing rope.

loans.name: Irayda

texts.es:
Irayda is a member of the LA MUJER RIOJANA Bank, and lives in San Martín, Rioja Province, Rioja District. She runs a sewing workshop from her home in Jr: Angaisa 240. Eager to support her husband, bring her 2 children up well and be close to them, she decided to pursue what she loved doing, and so she focused all her determination and creativity on her sewing workshop, thanks to the support from her husband who has always backed her 100%. With this loan of S/. 500.00, which will be paid in four monthly instalments, she will buy different coloured threads, and a variety of materials : cotton, lycra, polypima. She will buy good quality material in different designs, per metre, in order to meet her customers’ demands and proviD. a good service. Irayda is 38 years old and lives with her mother-in-law. She has learned to make her own decisions in life, and her aim is to have her own clothes shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is a member of the LA MUJER RIOJANA Bank, and lives in San Martín, Rioja Province, Rioja District. She sells salchipapas (fried hot dog slices and french fries) and salchi-pollo (fried chicken and french fries). Her business is based on the main streets in the city, where there are plenty of customers on a daily basis who enjoy this type of food. She started this business with the help of her daughters, as a result of the difficult economic situation they were facing. And so, their situation improved and now the business is making consistent sales on a daily basis. With the loan of S/ 3000.00 which will be paid back over a period of 6 months, she will buy the ingredients needed for her dishes such as: bags of hot dog slices, vegetables for salads, tubs of oil, sauces such as mayonnaise, ketchup, tubs of mustard, as well as utensils such as: throw-away plates, forks, and cups, which will bring her more customers and ensure her business of the highest quality and hygiene standard. Isabel is a persistent and friendly woman. She is 52 and lives with her two daughters, who motivate her each day. For the future, she hopes to improve and expand the environment where her business can develop and offer a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Isabel es socia del BANCO COMUNAL “LA MUJER RIOJANA”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. Rioja y distrito D. Rioja se dedica a la venta D. Salchi-papa y salchi-pollo, su negocio se ubica en un local D. las principales calles D. la ciudad, donD. diariamente acuden gran cantidad D. clientes que gustan D. este tipo D. comidas. Se inicio en este negocio con la ayuda D. sus hijas debido a la difícil situación económica en que estaba atravesando , iniciando así su crecimiento económico, hoy en día tiene asegurada su venta diaria. Con este préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 que devolverá en un plazo D. 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación D. salchi papas y salchi pollos, como: papas en sacos, verduras para las ensaladas, aceite en baldes , cremas como, mayonesa, kepchu, mostaza en baldes ,utensilios como: platos, tenedores, vasos descartables que harán posible la buena atención a sus clientes ya cada vez son numerosos y exigen una atención D. buena calidad e higiénica. Isabel es una mujer perseverante y muy amigable, tiene 52 años, vive con su sus dos hijas, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y alcanzar sus objetivos, desea para el futuro mejorar y ampliar el ambiente donD. desarrolla su negocio y así dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline is a member of “SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN “ Bank and lives in San Martín, Rioja. Her business is located in Jr Tupac Amarú N 330. Here she sell necessities and groceries in general, such as fizzy drinks. With support from her family, tenacity and dedication, she has been able to develop her business. When she started she only had a half-empty shelf, but now she is offering a variety of products. With this loan of S/.800.00 which she will pay back over 6 months, she will buy rice, bags of sugar, milk, oil, detergents, soaps and cleaning products in general, fizzy drinks and different sweets to fill her shop and offer her customers some variety. Jackeline is 21 years old and lives with her Mum and son, who motivate her to continue on each day and achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

La señora Jackeline es socia del Banco Comunal. “SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN “ , vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Rioja, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr Tupac Amarú N 330, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general ,como también bebidas gasificadas. Con el apoyo de su familia, la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio solo tenia un andamio casi vació, ahora oferta variedad de productos. Con este préstamo de S/.800.00 que devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en bolsas, leche, aceite en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles de limpieza en general, gaseosas y diversas golosinas para surtir su negocio y así poder ofertar variedad y novedad a sus clientes. La señora Jackeline tiene 21 años, vive con su Mamá y su hijo, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas.

loans.use: To purchase stock (groceries)

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Mrs Karina is a partner in the Communal Bank "Creative Women" and lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Moyabamba. She dedicates herself to the sale of Rena Were brand name products in her own house located at Jr. Ana Lucia Nro 205, and her clients come to her.

The idea of the store came about of the necessity to support her husband and in this manner help with the economic dispenses of the house, especially the education of her three youngest children. This is how the sale of Rena Were products came about.

WIth this loan of S/. 3,000.00 ($ 1000.25), to be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase products such as: Rena Ware brand name pressure cookers, filters, groomers and other products that will satisfy the needs of her clients.

She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children who are still dependent on her. Her goal for the future is to have a grocery story and to sell things for wholesale or retail.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Karina es socia del Banco Comunal “MUJERES CREATIVAS ”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyabamba, distrito de Moyabamba, se dedica a la venta de productos de la marca RENA WERE en su propia casa ubicado Jr. Anda Lucia Nro 205, donde acuden sus clientes. La idea del negocio surgió por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, y de esta manera poder aportar económicamente en los gastos de la casa, sobretodo en la educación a sus 3 menores hijos de esta manera se inicio en la venta de productos RENA WERE . Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que pagará en 6 meses, comprará productos como: ollas de la marca Rena Were, filtros, pulidor y perillas para poder llegar a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que todavía depende de ella, su meta en el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes y vender al por mayor y menor.

loans.use: Purchase of Rena Were brand name products (pressure cooker, filter, etc)

loans.name: Lita Alcidia

texts.es:
Mrs Lita is a partner in the Communal Bank "Santo Cristo de Bagazn". She lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Rioja. She business is located in her own house at Jr. 7 de Junio N º264. She sells general food supplies, candy and other products consumed on a daily basis.

Brought about by the necessity of supporting her husband, in order to aid economically with spendings of the house, and thanks to her perseverance in her work she was able to little by little stock up until she had a store supplied with all the products required by the inhabitants of the neighborhood in which she lives.

With the loan of S/. 800.00 ($ 275.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she would purchase bulk quantities of packets of noodles in different brands and varieties, preserved fish in boxes, bags of sugar and rice and liters of oil as well as stocking up on sodas and candy and personal cleansing products.

Mrs Lita is 22 years old and is very sure of herself and is characterized as being a woman who fights for what she wants, is very hard working, responsible and persistent. Her dream is to have her own distribution company for products and to secure the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lita es socia del Banco Comunal “SANTO CRISTO DE BAGAZAN” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Rioja y distrito de Rioja, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en Jr. 7 de Junio N º264, en él vende abarrotes en general, golosinas y otros productos comestibles de consumo diario. Surgió por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo, y de esta manera poder aportar económicamente en los gastos de la casa, gracias a su perseverancia en el trabajo hizo que poco a poco vaya creciendo hasta llegar a tener una bodega surtida con todos aquellos artículos que son de requeridos por los moradores del barrio en el que vive. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 para pagar en 6 cuotas, comprará fideos en paquetes de distintas marcas y variedades, conservas de pescado en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros, y a granel, además de surtir con bebidas gasificadas y golosinas y productos de aseo personal. La señora Lita tiene 22 años se siente muy segura de si misma se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante, sueña con tener su propia distribuidora de producto y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of general products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Mrs Marisa is a partner in the Communal Bank "The Riojana Woman". She lives in the San Martin region, in the province and district of Rioja. She dedicates herself to the preparation and sale of food, in an equipped location at jr. Santo Toribo Nº 835, where her customers come on a daily basis. They are inhabitants of the area or transits from nearby locations.

Her experience in the preparation of diverse types of food, her maturity and the necessity of owning her own business propelled her to begin this business, in order to provide an education to her children.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($ 350.00), to be repaid in 6 months, she would stock her store by purchasing bulk quantities of rice, bags of sugar, packets of noodles, oil and eggs. She would also purchase stainless steel pots for the preparation of food.

Mrs Marisa is 38 years old, is a very enthusiastic and happy woman together with her children and is a humble person whose dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Marisa es socia del Banco Comunal “LA MUJER RIOJANA”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Rioja y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado ubicado en el jr. Santo Toribio Nº 835 donde diariamente acuden su comensales que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio, la impulsaron a iniciarse en este negocio, para poder educar a sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 que serán pagados en 6 meses implementó su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, fideos en paquetes, aceite a granel huevos en jabas, también implementó con la compra de ollas de acero inoxidable para la preparación de sus alimentos. La señora Marisa tiene 38 años, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre que junto a sus hijos y con la humildad que demuestra sueña con mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase greater consumable good. Purchase cooking utensils.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs Nelly belongs to the Communal Bank "Maria Gracia". She lives in the San Martin region, in the Moyobamba province and district, and her business is located in the street jr. callao cuadro 7. Her services are in cosmetology and she has a beauty salon.

Thanks to a loan from Manuela Ramos she was able to renovate her beauty salon which during many years has generated income that has permitted herself to cover the necessities for her family. Her perseverance and dedication has successfully allowed the business to increase considerably.

With the loan she is asking for of S/. 800.00 ($ 275.00) to be repaid in 6 months, she would purchase an armchair, a machine to cut hair, hairspray, scissors and hair dyes of varying colors.

Mrs Nelly is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children. Her business provides work for other persons during times of celebrations and promotions. For now she is supported by one person. Her dream is to be abel to own a spa.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal” MARIA GRACIA”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia Moyobamba, distrito de Moyobamba, su negocio está ubicado en el jr. callao cuadra 7, ella presta sus servicios como cosmetóloga en su salón de belleza. Gracias al préstamo que Manuela Ramos le otorgó pudo renovar su salón de belleza que durante muchos años le genera ingresos que le permiten cubrir necesidades de su familia, la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente. Con el crédito recibido por S/. 800.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará un sillón, una maquina para cortar pelo, cepilladores laca, tijeras, tintes de distintos colores, La señora Nelly tiene 44 años vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su negocio brinda trabajo a otras personas en épocas de fiestas de promociones por ahora cuenta con un personal que le apoya , su meta es llegar a tener su spa.

loans.use: Purchase furniture, tools and hair dyes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa is a partner of Communal Bank "Creative Women", and lives in the San Martin region and the Moyobambo province and district in the El Dorado neighborhood. She dedicates herself to the preparation and sale of food, in an equipped location in the central market of the afore-mentioned city, in the food section where her customers come on a daily basis.

She is a widow and in her eagerness to keep going for her sons and provide them with a better education and stay near to them she decided to dedicate herself to what she liked best, the sale of typical food. She began this business by borrowing a small place in the market and thanks to her perseverance and efforts she was able to purchase it in order to continue working.

With this loan of S/. 400.00 ($150.00) to be repaid in 4 months, she would like to purchase bulk quantities of rice, bags of sugar and oil to reduce the very elevated costs.

Mrs Rosa is 70 years old, lives with one of her daughters who drives the business. She considers herself a fulfilled woman with plenty of experience.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “MUJERS CREATIVAS ”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyobamba en el jr. El Dorado barrio de belén Nº 166, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado y ubicada en el mercado central de dicha ciudad, sección comidas donde diariamente acuden su comensales. Al quedar viuda y en el afán de sacar adelante a sus hijos y dar una mejor educación y estar cerca de ellos decide dedicarse a lo que tanto le gusta, la venta de comida tipo menú. Inició su negocio prestando un pequeño puesto dentro del mercado y que gracias a su perseverancia y esfuerzo pudo comprar para así seguir trabajando. Con el préstamo de S/. 400.00 a ser pagados en 4 meses, implementó su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, aceite a granel ya que sus costos cada vez son más elevados. La señora Rosa tiene 70 años, vive con una de sus hijas quien le impulsa en el negocio, ella se considera una mujer realizada llena de experiencia.

loans.use: Purchase greater amounts of consumable goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Lesbia Elisalda

texts.es:
Sra. Lesbia Elisalda B. P. was born in the town of Bluefields. She is 38 years old and is married to Sr. Miguel Ángel Hernández who is a taxi driver earning minimum wage. His wages do not cover the cost of basic necessities. They have four children in high school.

For the past four years Sra. B. has been selling used clothing to passers-by who pick out her store because she offers a variety of clothing (children’s clothes, sheets, men’s and women’s clothing for all ages). With the income from this business, she pays for the education of her children.

Sra. B.’s customers are asking for more children’s clothing, but at the moment she does not have sufficient capital to buy any more packages. For this reason she is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a package of clothing for children. By investing in this way, she will increase her income and satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Lesbia Elisalda B. P. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Miguel Ángel Hernández quien trabaja como taxista el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios secundarios.

La Sra. B. vende ropa usada hace 4 años teniendo como clientes a los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropas (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades) con el ingreso de su negocio paga los estudios de sus hijos.

La Sra. B. tiene mas demanda de ropa para niños y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de ropa para niños y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de ropa para niños a $ 300.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase one package of clothing for children.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is a member of the Maria Gracia community bank; she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyobamba.  Her business is located on 430 Jr. Iquitos.  She has a general store.  Thanks to the support from her husband, children and her own efforts, the business has grown significantly, considering that she started selling items on a small table and now she has display counters and shelves.

The $600 USD (S/.1,700) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to purchase different types and brands of packaged pasta, boxes of preserved food, sacks of rice and sugar, oil in liter bottles, cases of eggs, boxes of milk, cleaning and personal hygiene products; all highly demanded by her clients.

She is 45 years old, lives with her husband and one of her children, who is the reason for the effort and constant dedication put into her daily activities. She considers herself independent to make decisions and manage the business. Her charisma attracts clients that receive good service and a well supplied store.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosario es socia del Banco Comunal “MARIA GRACIA “ vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Moyobamba, su negocio esta ubicado en el jr. Iquitos 430 se dedica a la venta de abarrotas en general . Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos ya su propio esfuerzo, ha logrado que el negocio crezca considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio comenzó vendiendo sobre una pequeña mesa y actualmente su negocio es muy variado y, lo exhibe en sus vitrinas y andamios.

El préstamo recibido de S/. 1,700.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, con dicho capital compró fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas de litro, huevos en javas, Leche en cajas , productos de Limpieza y aseo personal y detergentes debido a que estos artículos son muy requeridos por sus clientes .

Tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y 1 de sus hijos, motivo de su lucha y dedicación constante a sus actividades diarias de su negocio. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes además de atenderlas con amabilidad y tener un negocio surtido.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products.

loans.name: Ervadene Darcy

texts.es:
Sra. Ervadene Darcy H. W. was born in the town of Bluefields. She is 50 years old and is married to Sr. Alfredo Gordon who is unemployed at the moment. They have six young children. For the past 18 years, Sra. H. has been selling used clothing. Her customers are from the Puerto El Bluff neighbourhood; they come to her store because she offers a variety of clothing (children’s clothes, sheets, men’s and women’s clothing for all ages). It should be noted the only income from this small business comes from the sale of used clothing.

Sra. H.’s customers are asking for more women’s clothing, but at the moment she does not have enough money to buy any more packages. For this reason she is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a package of mixed clothing for women. By investing in this way, she will increase her income and satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Ervadene Darcy H. W. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alfredo Gordon quien en estos momentos esta desempleado, ambos tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. H. vende ropa usada hace 18 años teniendo como clientes a los habitantes del Puerto El Bluff que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropas (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades) cabe mencionar que el único ingreso de la microempresaria es el de la venta de ropa usada.

La Sra. H. tiene mas demanda de paca de ropa mixta para mujeres y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de ropa mixta para mujeres y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de ropa mixta para mujeres a $ 300.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy a package of mixed clothing for women.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 37.50 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 37.50 dólares

loans.name: Adriana Asunción

texts.es:
Sra. Adriana Asunción G. M. was born in the town of Bluefields. She is 30 years old and is married to Sr. Carlos Bladimir Obando who is a construction worker. The minimum wage he earns does not cover the cost of basic necessities. They have two young children.

For the last year Sra. G. has been the owner of a general store. Her customers are the people from the neighbourhood who like her store because of the variety of goods she offers (grains, juices, soups, soft drinks, natural fruit juices etc.) With the income from her business, she pays for her children’s education.

It should be noted that the products that she offers are in high demand. Right now she needs to buy 2 100K sacks of rice ($48 per sack), 2 100K sacks of sugar ($43 per sack), 1 drum of cooking oil ($40), and 1 100K sack of beans ($50). By investing in these products, Sra.G. will increase her income and satisfy her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Adriana Asunción G. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Carlos Bladimir Obando quien trabaja como obrero de construcción el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad.

La Sra. G. es propietaria de una pulpería hace 1 año teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas) con el ingreso de su negocio paga los estudios de sus hijos.

Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 2 quintales de arroz a $ 48.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 43.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidones de aceite a $ 40.00 dólares el bidón, 1 quintales de frijoles a $ 50.00 dólares el quintal, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, and soap for washing clothes.

payments.comment: Corresponde a las cuotas numero 03,04,05 y 06.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida belongs to “La Primavera” (The Spring) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyobamba. Her business is located in MZ B Lt. 3 La Primavera. Zoraida is a cosmetician and also sells beauty products in the beauty salon where she provides services to her friends and other clients. She decided to start her own business to generate her own income and grow as a person and professionally.

The $350 USD (S/.1,000) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to improve the beauty salon, purchase equipment to work with; such as mirrors, professional hair dryer, professional hair cutting and styling tools, as well as wholesale beauty products (Placenta Life brand), which is her bestselling brand and the one she uses in the beauty salon.

She is 36 years old and has 3 children; she is happy with what she does and satisfied with her achievements, her clientele keeps increasing and her goal is to complement this activity with another: selling shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Zoraida pertenece al Banco comunal ” LA PRIMAVERA”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia Moyobamba, distrito D. Moyobamba, su negocio está ubicado en el AA.HH. La Primavera MZ B Lt 3, ella presta sus servicios como cosmetóloga, la cual complementa con la venta D. productos D. belleza, en su salón D. estética en donD. atienD. a sus amigas (os) y demás clientes que acuden a diario. Decidió iniciar su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y profesionalmente.

El préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, mejoró su local, comprando materiales e instrumentos D. trabajo y equipos necesarios como espejos, cortadora y secadora D. cabello profesional, también compró productos D. belleza al por mayor (producto Placenta Life) que es la línea que mas venD. y usa para atender a sus clientas.

Tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, está contenta con lo que hace y satisfecha por los resultados obtenidos, hasta la fecha su clientela ha aumentado, su meta es llegar a implementar su actividad económica con otra que es la venta D. zapatos.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for beauty salon and wholesale beauty products.

loans.name: Rosana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosana belongs to the “Mujeres Valientes” (brave women) community bank, located in 123 Jr. Ica, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 48 years old and has 4 children, her husband is a taxi driver, but the income is not enough. Therefore, with a first loan of $100 USD (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos, Rosana decided to invest in a business to buy and sell “motocarros” (small three-wheeled motorcycle carts).

She currently has this business and gets up at 7 am, prepares breakfast for her family and then works on her house and the business.

With the $850 USD (S/. 2,500) loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 second hand motocarros, motor parts, etc.

Rosana is happy for the business support given by Manuela Ramos, without them it would have been impossible to start the business and get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosana pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Ica 126, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero los ingresos económicos son muy pocos, es así que Rosana con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un negocio D. compra y venta D. motocarros.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. compra y venta D. motocarros, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro 2 motocarros D. segunda, piezas para su motor, etc.

Rosana esta feliz por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio, pues sin ellos no hubiera sido posible emprender su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase second hand motorcycle carts and motor parts.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juices, cookies, water, candy, and popsicles.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 20.83 dólares

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the “Mujeres Valientes” (brave women) community bank, located in 123 Jr. Lima, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 60 years old and has 6 children, her husband is a laborer. Their income didn’t cover their family expenses and this is why Rosa received a loan of $100 USD (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos and invested in a business to sell groceries.

Currently, she owns a small general store. She gets up at 7 am prepares breakfast for her family and opens the store to service clients until 8 p.m.

With the $525 USD (S/. 1,500) loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy rice, milk, oil, eggs, detergent, pasta etc.

Rosa is a lady that has lived long and has achieved great things to the benefit of her family, even though she counts with the support from her children, she wishes to work and obtain income from her own effort, she demonstrates this everyday by working at the general store. Her children are proud of her.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Lima 296, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es obrero, pero los ingresos económicos no satisfacen sus gastos familiares, es así que Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su esposo y de ella, de allí abre su bodega para atender a sus clientes hasta las 8 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro arroz, leche, aceite, huevo, detergentes, fideos, etc.

Rosa es una señora que ha vivido mucho y ha logrado grandes cosas para el beneficio de su familia, pero ella a pesar de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos desea trabajar y obtener sus ganancias con su propio esfuerzo que a diario se refleja al manejar su propio negocio de abarrotes, sus hijos están felices orgullosos de ella.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale products for general store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the “Mujeres Valientes” (brave women) community bank, located in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 57 years old and has 3 children, her husband is a merchant. The income was too low to maintain a home, thus Rosa received a loan of $100 USD (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos and invested it in a chicken business.

Currently, she breeds and sales chicken in small quantities. She gets up at 7 a.m., prepares breakfast for the family and then works around the house and in her business.

With this $350 USD (S/. 1,000) loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy wood and lime to fix the chicken business.

Rosa only wishes to support her family through her work and see them improve which is one of her main goals as a mother. She is very happy with the support given by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr: Eduardo del Aguila 662, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es Comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos son muy bajos para mantener su hogar, es así que Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/.300 deciD. invertir en la construcción D. un pequeño galpón D. pollos.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. crianza y venta D. pollos al por menor, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dedica al cuidado D. sus pollitos y a los quehaceres D. su hogar.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro madera y cal para ambientar su galpón D. pollos.

Rosa solo desea apoyar a su familia a través D. su trabajo y ver que se superen por que es uno D. sus principales objetivos como madre y esta muy contenta con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos .

loans.use: Purchase wood and lime

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana E. G. is from the city of Bluefields, she is 64 years old, and is a single mother with 9 grown children. Mrs. E. has made ‘Nacatamales’ (large tamales very popular in Central America) for over 40 years, having as clients the residents of her neighborhood and passers-by who buy from her because she offers a native product from our country. It should be mentioned that selling Nacatamales is her only income. Right now Mrs. E. needs to buy 50 pounds of pork at US$2.00 per pound; this is one of the ingredients of this typical dish from our country. Since she does not have sufficient capital to buy this ingredient in large quantities, with this loan she will be able to increase her earnings and satisfy her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Juana E. G. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera de 9 hijos mayores de edad. La Sra. E. hace Nacatamales por mas de 40 años, teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio y transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer un producto típico de nuestro país, cabe mencionar que el único ingreso que recibe es el de su negocio de venta de Nacatamal. En estos momentos la Sra. E. necesita comprar: 50 libras de carne de cerdo a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, que es uno de los ingredientes principales de este platillo típico de nuestro país, ya que ella no cuenta con el suficiente capital para comprar este ingrediente en grandes cantidades, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase pork

loans.name: Elisa Marcela

texts.es:
Small business entrepreneur Elisa Marcela O. L.is from the city of Bluefields, is 53 years old, and is a single mother with 6 grown children. The only income she has is that of her business. Mrs. O. has been owner of a section in the city’s municipal market for more than 35 years where she sells a variety of products (plantains, bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, limes, onions, carrots, lettuce, oranges, cucumber, water melon, mandarins among other things). She has as clients state institutions (hospital, police, naval district) and the passers-by who patronize her business because the variety of products she offers. It should be pointed out that the demand for the products that she sells has not decreased, as they are highly consumed by the population.. Now she needs to buy: 300 pounds of potatoes at US$41.00 per 100 pounds, 4 cases of tomatoes at US$22.00 per case, 300 pounds of onions at US$20.00 per 100 pounds, 100 heads of cabbage at US$1.00 per head, 2 cases of sweet peppers at US$15.00 per case, 2 cases of carrots at US$15.00 per case, 1 case of chayote squash at US$22.00 per case, and 100 units of bananas at US$0.47 per unit. With this loan she will be able to meet the ever-increasing demands of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La Microempresaria Elisa Marcela O. L.es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tienen 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad. El único ingreso que tiene la microempresaria es la de su negocio. La Sra. O. es propietaria de un tramo en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad por más de 35 años donde ofrece una variedad de productos (plátano, banano, repollo, tomate, papa, limón, cebolla, zanahoria, lechuga, naranja, pepino, sandilla, mandarina, entre otras cosas) teniendo como clientes a las instituciones del estado (hospital, Policía y el Distrito Naval) y los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos. Este es el segundo crédito de la microempresaria. Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no han disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 3 quintales de papa a $ 41.00 dólares el quintal, 4 cajas de tomate a $ 22.00 dólares la caja, 3 quintales de cebolla a $20.00 dólares el quintal, 100 cabezas de repollo a $ 1.00 dólar cada cabeza, 2 cajas de chiltomas a $15.00 dólares la caja, 2 cajas de zanahoria a $ 15.00 dólares la caja, 1 caja de chayote a $ 22.00 dólares la caja y 100 unidades de banano a $ 0.47 centavos dólar la unidad, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase potato, onion, sweet pepper , banana, chayote squash, carrot, tomato and cabbage

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 83.33 dólares

loans.name: Marta Iris

texts.es:
Small business entrepreneur Marta Iris O. G. is a native of the city of Bluefields, she is 42 years old, and is married to Mr. Margarito Torres who is owner of a butcher shop.  They have four children;  one is in secondary school, and three study in university.  With her business income Mrs. O. pays her children’s educational expenses.  Mrs. O. has sold cheese, cream, curd, and eggs for more than 20 years, having as clients state institutions (hospital, police, and naval district) and the passers-by who prefer her for the variety of dairy products she offers.  This is the second loan for this small businesswoman.  It should be pointed out that the demand for the products that she sells has not decreased, as they are highly consumed by the population.  Now she needs to buy:  362 pounds of cheese at US$1.00 per pound and 150 pounds of cream at US$0.92 a pound.  With this loan she will be able to meet the ever-increasing demands of her clients.


 Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La microempresaria Marta Iris O. G. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Margarito Torres quien es propietario de una carnicería, ambos tienen 4 hijos, 1 cursa estudios secundarios y 3 de ellos estudian  en la universidad,  con el ingreso del negocio la Sra. O. paga los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. La Sra. O.  vende queso, crema, cuajada y huevo por más de 20 años, teniendo como clientes  a las instituciones del estado (hospital, Policía y el Distrito Naval) y los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos lácteos. Este es el segundo crédito de la microempresaria. Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no han disminuido  su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 362 libras de queso a $ 1.00 dólar la libra y 150 libras de crema a $ 0.92 centavos dólar la libra,  con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase cheese and cream

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 83.33 dólares

loans.name: Ylmer

texts.es:
Ylmer belongs to “Las Divinas” (the wonderful) community bank, located in the district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 47 years old and has 4 children, her husband has a job in the education sector. The income was not enough for her family, thus Ylmer received a loan of $100 USD (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos and invested it in a business to sell personal use items, such as women clothing, lingerie, shoes and other. Currently, she sells different types of merchandise. She gets up at 7 a.m., makes breakfast for her family and sells merchandise from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. With the loan of $525 USD (S/. 1,500), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy clothing for women, men and kids, towels, bed sheets, shoes, lingerie and underwear, etc. Ylmer is a hardworking woman and an excellent mother, because she works with the purpose of helping her family. Her business just began to grow and she has a future ahead as an entrepreneur, she is very thankful for the support given by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ylmer pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Trujillo-252 A, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es empleado del sector educación, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no son los suficientes para su familia, es así que Ylmer con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un negocio D. venta D. artículos D. uso personal como ropa para damas, ropa interior, zapatos, entre otros. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio D. venta D. mercadería diversa, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, D. allí se dedica a la venta D. su mercadería a sus clientes desD. las 9 am hasta la 3 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compró ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, toallas, sabanas, zapatos, ropas interiores, etc. Ylmer es una mujer muy trabajadora y una excelente madre por que su trabajo lo realiza con el único fin D. ayudar a su familia . Su negocio recién empieza a crecer y tiene todo un futuro como mujer empresaria, esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, towels, bedding, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, oil, yeast, butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, cocoa, dried fruit and raisins

payments.comment: La cuota real es de $ 41.67 dólares.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the community bank Sol Naciente, located in Jr. Cajamarca 100 in the Calleria district of the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 54 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a sobador, a traditional practicioner treating dislocations and other injuries through manipulation and massage, but his earnings do not meet the family's expenses. For that reason, Rosa decided to invest her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the launch of a business selling healthy food products made by Union, a company associated with the Seventh Day Adventist Church, which gives students attending one of its 3 Peruvian universities the opportunity to pay for their studies through flexible work in the food factory.

Now Rosa has her own business selling these healthy food products. She rises at 7 AM to prepare breakfast for her children and her husband. Later, from 3 PM until 7 PM, she works distributing and collecting payment for her products.

With this loan of 1000 soles which she will repay in 4 months, Rosa will buy 60 each of piononos and kekes, two typical Peruvian pastries, along with 45 loaves of whole grain bread, 15 whole grain pastries, and more.

Rosa walks a long way to be able to sell her products., though that has not been an obstacle to her moving ahead. She has a special charisma that allows her to attract clients, and more clients every day. She feels happy to be member of the Manuela Ramos family, since the support they give her allows her to work and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, ubicado en el Jr. Cajamarca 100, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es sobador, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no satisfacen sus gastos familiares, es así que Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de productos UNION.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con su negocio de venta de productos Unión, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo, luego se dedica a la repartición y cobranza de sus productos desde las 3 pm hasta las 7 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró 60 unidades de piononos, 60 unidades de kekes, 45 unidades de panes integrales, 15 unidades de kekes integrales, etc.

Rosa es una mujer que tiene que caminar mucho para poder vender sus productos, pero eso no es impedimento para salir adelante, posee un carisma especial para atraer a sus clientes que cada día son mas y mas, ella se siente feliz de pertenecer a la familia de Manuela Ramos, ya que el apoyo que le brindan le permite trabajar y ayudar en su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of Union brand healthy food products in wholesale quantities (pastry, bread, etc.)

loans.name: Verita

texts.es:
Verita is a member of the community bank Las Divinas, located in Jr Pucallpa 655 in the Calleria district of the region of Ucayali in Peru. She is 33 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a shopkeeper but his income is too low to meet the family's economic needs. For this reason, Verita decided to start a food sales business with the first loan she received from Manuel Ramos, for 300 soles (Peruvian currency).

She works in her business in the evenings from her own home. She rises at 7 AM to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. Later she works preparing the meals she will sell from 5 PM until 10 PM.

With this loan of 1500 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals along with materials to add atmosphere to her place of business.

Verita is a very hardworking woman. She is moving her family ahead with her work with effort and humility.She has returned to Manuela Ramos for a second loan as a woman visibly committed to growing her successful business and continuing to move her family ahead. She appreciates all the support that Manuela Ramos provides to her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Verita pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr Pucallpa 655, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos es muy bajo para sus necesidades familiares, es así que Verita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comida.

Su actividad la desarrolla por las noches en su propia casa, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para ponerlos a la venta desde la 5 pm hasta las 10 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y materiales para ambientar su local.

Verita es una mujer muy trabajadora que saca a delante a su familia con su trabajo a base de esfuerzo y humildad, manifiesta que se ha vuelto una mujer que solo piensa en hacer crecer su negocio y ha salir adelante junto con su esposo y sus hijos, y agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brindan.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of ingredients and purchase of materials for her place of business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia is a member of the community bank Mujeres Valientes (Courageous Women), located in the street Guillermo Sisley 675 in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 60 years old and the mother of 3 children. Because her income was insufficient to meet her family's expenses, Virginia decided to start a replacement parts business with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, for 400 soles (Peruvian currency).

Now Virginia has her own store where she sells replacement parts for cars and motorcycles. She rises every morning at 7 AM to prepare breakfast for her children; later she spends the day tending to her business, until 8 pm, when she ends her work day.

With this loan for 3,500 soles which she will repay in 4 months, Virginia will buy spare tires, bearings, gears, etc.

Virginia continues achieving many successes in her business and satisfying the needs of her family. Although she already owns a well established business, she does not hesitate to drive herself to continue growing the business, and make herself the successful owner of a large business. She feels happy about the support Manuela Ramos provides to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Virginia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Guillermo Sisley 675, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, pero sus ingresos económicos no son suficientes para sus gastos, es así que Virginia con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertir en un negocio D. venta D. repuestos.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una tienda D. venta D. repuestos D. motos y motocarros, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, para después dedicarse a atender el negocio hasta las 8pm.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compro rodamientos, catalinas, rodajes, llantas, etc.

Virginia sigue logrando con su negocio muchos éxitos, satisfaciendo las necesidades D. su familia, a pesar D. tener un negocio bien establecido no duda en seguir aumentándolo y convertirse en una gran empresaria. Se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado por Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of replacement parts for cars and motorcycles.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad is a member of the community bank Las Divinas, located in the street Apurimac 130, in the district of Calleria in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 61 years old and the mother of 10 children. Her husband is a bricklayer, but his meager income does not meet the family's expenses. As a result, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos Trinidad decided to start her own beauty products business.

Trinidad works selling a variety of beauty products. She rises at 7 AM in order to prepare breakfast for her children. Later she spends the day distributing her beauty products to her clients until 5 pm. With this loan of 1700 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be repaid in 6 months she will buy a large quantity of beauty products in order to increase her sales.

Apart from her commitment to support her children, Trinidad works because of the way it makes her feel, and because it allows her to independently manage her finances and help with the household expenses. She is appreciative of the support that Manuela Ramos provides her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Trinidad pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 130, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre de 10 hijos, su esposo es albañil, pero sus ingresos económicos son muy bajos y no son suficientes para su familia, es así que Trinidad con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La señora Trinidad se dedica a la venta de diversos productos de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, para luego dedicarse a la repartición de sus productos de belleza a sus clientes hasta 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para incrementar sus ventas.

Trinidad a pesar de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos trabaja para poder sentirse bien y para que sus ganancias los maneje de manera independiente para poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, esta agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Buy a variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a member of the community bank Las Divinas, located in the street L Paz 135, in the Callería district of the region of Ucayali in Peru. She is 45 years old and the mother of 3 children. Because her earnings were not sufficient to pay for her family's expenses, Yolanda decided to start a business with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, for 300 soles (Peruvian currency).

Now Yolanda has a her own business selling soft drinks. She rises every morning at 7 am to prepare breakfast for her children and later hse works all day selling cold drinks from her home, until 6 pm. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, Manuela will buy 5 boxes of soft drinks, mineral water, etc.

Yolanda is a woman who has taken hard hits from life. All that she wishes for now is to work in order to support her children in their studies. She is very happy with the help the Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. La Paz 135, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 3 hijos, pero sus ingresos económicos no son suficientes para su familia, es así que Yolanda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y luego dedicarse a la venta de sus bebidas heladas en su casa, hasta las 6pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro 5 cajas de gaseosas, agua mineral, etc.

Yolanda es una mujer que ha sentido los golpes de la vida, lo único que desea es trabajar para poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, esta muy contenta con la ayuda que le brinda Mañuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Buy wholesale quantities of soft drinks and mineral water.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida is a member of the community bank Mujeres Valientes (Courageous Women), located in the the street Coronel Portillo, in the Callería district of the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 35 years old and is the mother of 1 daughter. Because her income is insufficient for her expenses, she decided to start a business selling beauty products with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency) .

Nelida now lives from the beauty products business she started. She rises at 7 in the morning in order to prepare breakfast for her daughter, and then spends the day selling her beauty products to her clients.

With this loan of 2,300 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy perfumes, colognes, deoderants, earrings; necklaces, shampoos, rings, miscellaneous accessories, etc.

Every day Nelida has to invest lots of effort in order to have clients and sell her beauty products. Her sacrifice is reflected in her earnings, which are the direct result of the effort and perserverance she puts out each day, with one objective: moving her daughter ahead in life. She is very happy and very proud of herself.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelida pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr Coronel Portillo 836, el Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 1 hija, pero sus ingresos económicos son insuficientes para sus gastos, es así que Nelida con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de su hija, de allí se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró perfumes, colonias, desodorantes, aretes, collares, shampoo, anillos, chilindrinas, etc.

Nelida a diario tiene que esforzarse para poder tener clientes y vender sus productos de belleza, su sacrificio se ve reflejado en sus ganancias, pues son propios de la lucha y perseverancia que a diario realiza ,con el fin de salir adelante con su hija. Esta muy orgullosa y feliz de si misma.

loans.use: Buy beauty items and accessories.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon A. lives in Prey Dong Teok Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is currently in the business of rice plantation. Her husband, Mr. Saron Mich, is a government officer who gets only a small salary to support his family. They have nine children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while three others are attending the local school. The remaining four are staying at home because they are too young to work or enroll in school.

In order to improve her family conditions, Mrs. Sokhon A. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Last year, Mrs. Sokhon A. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to cure a disease because one of her family members got typhoid and she needed to spend $200 to get them cured. Mrs. Sokhon A. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding in order to meet the economic needs of the family.

loans.name: Sichan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sichan S. is a villager in Sre Cheng Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sarith Chea, is a taxi driver who can generate a little income to meet the economic needs of the family. They have five children, three of whom are employed in different business activities, while the remaining two are enrolled in school.

Last year, Mrs. Sichan S. got a fainting spell, which made her unconscious. Her husband spent $150 to get her cured. For this reason, Mrs. Sichan S. does not have enough money to buy a piece of land to sell later at a better price. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Sichan S. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny D. is employed in a garment factory in Kraing Svay Village in Kampong Speu Province (she and her husband are shown in the picture). She is 34 and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sam Al Buth, is a subsistence farmer.

Mr. Sam Al Buth’s plantation has faced an obstacle because he does not have enough money to hire labourers to work the field. Thus, Mrs. Vanny D. decided to ask for a loan to solve this problem. In addition, she would use part of the money to buy fertilizers for the field. Last year, one of her children got dengue fever and Mrs. Vanny D. had unforeseen expenses to cure them. That is why today, she cannot afford to hire labourers to work the field.

loans.use: To hire labourers to work the field and buy fertilizers for the field.

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
Mr. Rady V. is a villager in Kraing Svay Village in Kampong Speu Province. He is currently a government officer who gets only a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Chhanny Sem, is a subsistence farmer. They have five children, all of whom are attending the local school.

Although the family members have different business activities, they still live in poor conditions. Therefore, Mr. Rady V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow in order to start another business in cow breeding. Last year, one of his children got dengue fever so Mr. Rady V. spent $125 to cure him. Because of this disease, Mr. Rady V. cannot afford a cow on his own. Mr. Rady V. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To start another business in cow breeding.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Mrs. Sima H. is a farmer in Kandal Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she is also a coal seller. Since her coal selling business activity has improved, Mrs. Sima H. would like to expand it. Thus, she asked for a loan to buy more coal to re-sell for a profit. Her husband, Mr. Chanbarith Khun, assists his wife in both business activities.

Mrs. Sima H. is 25 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Sima H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coal to re-sell for a profit.

loans.name: Samoern

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoern P. is a villager in Chaoeng Kdey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer. In her farming, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough cows to plow her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to add to the old one in order to be used as draft animals.

Her husband, Mr. Doem In, is a teacher and farmer. Mrs. Samoern P. is a 38 year old mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to the old one in order to be used as draft animals.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey C. works as a tailor from her house and can make around $2 per day. She has a sewing machine and provides service to people in her local area. Her husband is an English teacher and makes around $4 per day. They both live in Sophy Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. 

C. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle to use in her family, especially for her husband to go to work. The loan allows them to reduce their family expenses while commuting to work. Her husband said that he wants to offer additional educational courses to teach students to use computers. After successful repayment of this loan, he will request another loan to purchase a computer for his teaching business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use in her family, especially for her husband to go to work

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Try K. is a vegetable seller in Kandalleu Village, Kandal Province. K. is responsible for selling the crops at her local market. Her husband grows the crops that K. sells, including cabbage and other popular Cambodian vegetables. They earn around $3 per day. They work very hard every day. Due to a recent increase in her family’s expenses. Try K. needs to expand her business to increase her family income. 

K. is requesting a loan of $400 to use for her farming business. She will use the majority of the loan to purchase seeds for her husband to plant. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase petrol for their pumping machine. The pumping machine allows them to transfer water between plots of land for irrigation.

loans.use: To use for her farming business

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum T. is a subsistence farmer in Kandal Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, she also owns a small grocery store in the village.

Mrs. Prum T. is a 49 year old widow with five children, two of whom run a motorbike with cart to transport people or goods as a business. The three remaining children are attending the local school.

Mrs. Prum T.’s grocery store is too old so she wants to build a new one. Unfortunately, she has insufficient money to afford it. Therefore, Mrs. Prum T. asked for a loan to build a new, more attractive store in order to sell her products more easily.

loans.use: To build a new grocery store to replace the old one.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal C. is a villager in Ang Tunloap Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. Her husband, Mr. Ming Pun, is a farmer and coal seller. Mr. Ming Pun would like to improve his business by buying a cart, which would allow him to transport the coal and, thus, provide a convenient door-to-door service to his customers. In order to be able to afford this expense, Mrs. Sophal C. asked for a loan.

Mrs. Sophal C. is 51 and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another assists Mrs. Sophal C. in the grocery business. The youngest one is enrolled in school. Previously, Mrs. Sophal C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers and a pig for breeding. Mrs. Sophal C. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cart, which would allow Mr. Ming Pun to transport the coal and thus provide a convenient door-to-door service to his customers.

loans.name: Vech

texts.en:
Mrs. Vech M. is a subsistence farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. She cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, Mrs. Vech M. cultivates rice, while during the dry season, she grows vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Try Men, helps her out with the farming in his spare time from working in a kiln.

In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Vech M. now wants to start a cow breeding business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan. Mrs. Vech M. is a 38 year old mother of four children, three of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is too young to work or enrol in school. Her husband is shown in the left of the photo.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business in order to improve her family income.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him V. lives in Trapaing Chrov Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a rice farmer. Her husband, Mr. Kosal Im, helps her and, in addition, collects palm juice and processes it into palm sugar.

Because of their poor living conditions, Mrs. Him V. has insufficient money to buy a cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals. Thus, Mrs. Him V. asks for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Him V. is 25 and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Last year, Mrs. Him V.’s grandmother got ill and she had unforeseen expenses to treat her. Presently, her grandmother needs to be treated again. Because of these obstacles, Mrs. Him V. cannot afford her cow to start her new business. Mrs. Him V. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly S. and her husband live with their seven children in Khsom Village, Kandal Province. They are both farmers and combined earn around $2.60 per day growing rice. Because of the expenses associated with raising such a large family, S. and her husband must work hard every day. 

S. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop. She plans to use the remainder of the loan  to purchase insecticide, which will allow her to increase the yield of her crops. The loan will enable her to increase her revenue from her farming activities and thereby increase her family’s income. The picture is of Ly S.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Toeun

texts.en:
Mr. Toeun H. runs a farm in Prey Chum Village in Kampong Speu Province with his wife, Mrs. Heng Nean. Aside from this business activity, he also collects palm juice to produce palm sugar. His rice plantation now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy a cow to add to an old cow to use as draft animals.

Mr. Toeun H. is 25 years old and is the father of three children, one of whom is attending school, while the other two are staying at home because they are too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Toeun H. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers to support his field. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to an old cow to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Pring S. is a farmer. She is married and lives with her three children in Kandalkrom Village, Kandal Province. Mrs. S. works hard everyday and earns around $1.50 per day.  Her husband is a bricklayer and makes around $4 per day. 

Now S. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase an ox. The ox will allow her to improve her business by pulling a plow, which will allow her to more efficiently work her land. She plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.use: To purchase an ox

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S. makes Cambodian cakes and then sells them in her village, earning approximately $2.50 per day. Her cakes are popular so her business is growing. Her husband is a construction worker as well as a motorcycle taxi driver and makes about $5 per day. They have six children and live in Khsom Village, Kandal Province. 

Transportation is difficult so she is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for use by her family. The loan will allow the family to reduce their expenses. The picture is of S.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for use by her family

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhay O., 52, is a widow who sells groceries from her house in Anlongkangan Village, Kandal Province. She has seven children, one of whom is married. One of her other children works at a garment factory and uses her income to help support the family’s expenses. 

In order to grow her business, Chhay is requesting a loan in order to purchase more grocery stock.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock to sell

loans.name: Lealofi

texts.en: Lealofi L., 44, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the Taro, taamu and bananas business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 420 Tala (~175 USD).  SPBD loans are Lealofi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband is working as a carpenter and he helps run the business.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim was born in 1963. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Khodjali region. He has settled in the Absheron region.

Karim is married and has 4 children. He has run this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en: Tagi (his brother is pictured) is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region, the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is settled in the Absheron region. He has 6 years of experience in this business. Now this 51-year-old man needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for making cisterns. He is married and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for making cisterns

loans.name: Falanika

texts.en: Falanika N., 59, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and taamu business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has had 3 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 430 Tala (~179 USD).  SPBD loans are Falanika’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She we also use some of the loan to buy cement and timbers for home repair. She also runs a printing business.
