loans.use: Purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en: Tauva A., 55, is married with 1 child.  She has 3 years of experience in her general store business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Tauva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She also has a plantation business which helps as a back up to her general store.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Bashoratkhon

texts.en:
Bashoratkhon B. is 40 years old. She is married and the loving mother of five children. Her elder son is studying at the university and the rest of her children are of school age. Her husband is a master.

Bashoratkhon is a seamstress. She sews the national dresses for women and girls. Bashoratkhon works at home, accepting the orders and performing her duties. She also accepts orders to sew the outfits of bridegrooms for their weddings. Bashoratkhon purchases the fabrics required for sewing by herself in the market. Her daughter helps her with her business.

Bashoratkhon has been in this business for more than ten years. She is a very popular seamstress and has lots of orders. The business is stable and generates considerable income for the family.

Today, Bashoratkhon is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting a loan of $600 USD for the term of 12 months so she can purchase the new, modern fabrics for sewing the national dresses. Bashoratkhon thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in her loan payment. Support this woman with much strength and courage to keep working.

loans.use: To purchase the new modern fabrics of sewing the national dresses.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein I. is 24 years old. He is married. He has a child who is one and a half years old. Husein’s son is small now, but Husein is already working hard in order to ensure his son has the best future.

Husein sells foodstuffs like cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, and canned mayonnaise in the store, which he rents. He has been in this business for 8 years. Husein is very polite and his trading place is very popular among the local inhabitants. This means he has many clients. The business generates the main income for the family.

Today Husein requests 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 12 months. He is going to spend the loan on purchasing foodstuffs so he can enlarge the range of goods he sells. This will enable him to increase his sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of his family fully. Husein thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to enlarge the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria S., 45, is married with 6 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the chips and pop-corn business. She sells to the school and villagers 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She has a son who is working and helping her out with the business.

loans.use: Purchase  ingredients such as dripping, corn, bananas and plastic papers for packaging

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
Faizullo I. is 53 years old. He is married with three children.

Together with his wife, Faizullo sells fabrics to make the national dresses. Their store is located in the central local market. Faizullo has been in this business for 10 years. In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet, Faizullo travels to the neighboring town of Istaravshan almost every month to purchase new goods. During his business absence, Faizullo’s wife helps him in the market, making sales.

Faizullo has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not able to fully meet their demand. Therefore, he needs a loan of 3000 Somoni ($875 USD) for the term of 4 months. With the loan, he wants to increase his stock to earn more income. With the income, he will provide his children with a good education and help to meet all of their needs. Additionay, in the near future, he is planning to arrange the marriage of his son.

Your generosity can change their lives. Help them by contributing to the growth of his business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To Purchase the new fabrics to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise T., 53, is widowed with 6 children.  She has many years of experience with growing and selling cabbages, cucumbers, peas, pumpkin and spring onions. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Etevise’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan to  buy timbers, iron roofs and cement for home improvements She has two children that  help run the business and with  family needs

loans.use: Purchase chemicals,  pesticides and vegetables seeds

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en: Uputaua P., 40, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the Samoan healing business. She sells to the public and villagers 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Uputaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan for buying cements and timbers to repair her home. Her husband works and helps out with the family needs.

loans.use: Purchase oils and equipment needed for the healing

loans.name: Masina

texts.en: Masina V., 38, is married with 5 children.  She has many years of experience in the Samoan mats, hats and earing business. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Masina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband also works to help out with family needs.

loans.use: Purchase  tools and equipment for producing crafts

loans.name: Saliyakhon

texts.en:
Saliyakhon S. is 44 years old. She is married. Together with her husband, she has raised seven children.

For more than 10 years, Saliyakhon has sold vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions. Her daughter helps her with the business. Saliyakhon begins her workday every morning at 5:00 a.m. She buys the vegetables at wholesale from the local farmers and she sells them in the market. In the market, she is known among the people because of her attractive prices and friendly nature. All this allows Saliyakhon’s business to generate the stable and considerable income for her family.

Now it is the summer season and her goods are in great demand. For this reason, she is planning to purchase new and fresh vegetables for sale so she can earn more income. This will allow her to provide her children with a good education. For this purpose, she requests 2500 Somoni ($725 USDollars) for the term of 6 months.

Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Saliyakhon’s business.

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy Y. is 49 years old. She is married with four children, who all go to school. Tursunoy sells fabrics for sewing the national dresses. She has been in this business for almost 13 years. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and beautiful. When you see all these national dresses it seems that you are admiring the scenery, which is awaking from a cold winter. It is a feast of green leaves and grasses, of bright red and yellow tulips in the mountains and a blue sky, which is so close to you in spring. At the same time the national dress is one of the most important items in the dowry of a girl.

Tursunoy has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients about which textiles to choose for this or that occasion. This is why she has her constant and loyal customers. Her eldest daughter helps her with the business. Also, Tursunoy’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various income levels; she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. She has two trading places, in two different markets.

All this allows Tursunoy to keep her clientele and to make a good income. The income that she derives allows her to educate all of her children at a high level. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

Now, Tursunoy needs 3500 Somoni ($1025 USD) to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods she sells. Tursunoy promises to pay the loan in 4 months, without any violation. She expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase the new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe L., 44, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the barbeque foods business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has had 5 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Pepe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan for home improvement by buying cement, timber and an iron roof. Her husband also works to help out with the family  needs.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and materials needed for food production such as meats and vegetables.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Mr. Hak V. is a farmer in Prey Chum Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, he is also a bed maker. His wife, Mrs. Sim Sun, helps her husband on the farm. They have seV. children, four of whom are employed in different business activities, while two others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Although several family members work, they cannot improve their living conditions. Thus, Mr. Hak V. decided to expand his breeding activity and he asked for a loan to buy an extra cow. In the past, Mr. Hak V. had already obtained a loan to start a cow breeding business. Mr. Hak V. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an extra cow for his breeding business.

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Ol C. is a villager in Trapaing Chrov Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer. In her farming, Mrs. Ol C. now has insufficient draft animals to plow her rice field in order to cultivate rice. Thus, she asks for a loan to buy an additional cow. Her husband, Mr. Rath Don, besides helping her in the farm, collects palm juice to produce palm sugar to sell.

Mrs. Ol C. is 44 and the mother of three children, one of whom works as a construction worker, while another is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one is attending the local school. Previously, Mrs. Ol C. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to cultivate rice. Her husband is presented in the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en:
Nkechi O. is 48 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells electronics and household equipment. Nkechi learned this business in 12 months and started her own shop in 2003. She has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

Nkechi needs a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more electronics and household equipment. She says "thank you" to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more electronics inventory

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun S. is a bricklayer as well as a goldsmith who lives in Sophy Village, Banteay Meanchey Province. He makes around $3 per day. His wife is a homemaker and stays at home with their four children. Two of her children are goldsmiths and their income helps to support the family’s expenses, because Mr. S.’s income cannot support the whole family sufficiently. Now Noun is asking for a loan of $1000 for his children to use for the goldsmith business. The loan would allow the family to expand the business and increase their income.

loans.use: To use for the goldsmith business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria E. is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Gloria sells unisex clothing to the people of her community. Gloria learned the business in 6 months. She started her own business in 2007.

She needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more unisex clothes to meet the demands of her customers. She is a LAPO client. She expresses her gratitude to all

.

loans.use: To buy more unisex clothes to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Ean S. O. raises pigs and grows rice on her farmland in Krasaing Chrum Village, Kampong Thom Province. She can make about $5 per day and her husband can earn around $5 per day fishing in the Tonle Sap Lake. They have two children who live at home with them. Because she wishes to expand her farming business, O. is requesting a loan to purchase more farmland. The loan allows her to expand her farming business and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more farmland

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is 56 years old, and is married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She buys ice cream from the ice cream company, freezes it, and distributes to retailers. Joy A. learned this business from her friend in 5 months. She has been in this business since 2005. She has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

Joy is requesting a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more ice cream to sell. She says "thank you" to all.

loans.use: To buy  more varieties of ice cream to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng N. sells rice as well as fried rice with pork and chicken at a school. She has three children, all of whom are living in the family home with her. Two of her children are studying in University and are near graduation. Because of the difficulty of commuting to school for class and study sessions, N. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her children go to school. The loan will allow the family to reduce their transportation expenses and reduce the commute time to work and school.

The picture is one of N.'s sons.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children go to school

loans.name: Rotimi

texts.en:
Rotimi F. is 43 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City. Rotimi sells traditional women's dresses known as "wrappers." She learned this business in 6 months and started her own in 1996. Rotimi is a LAPO client.

She needs a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more wrappers to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all who made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more female wrappers to sell

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky O. is 52 years old and is married with 4 children. He lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Lucky sells and repairs electronics. He learned this business in 18 months and he started his own business in 1992. He has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

Lucky needs a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more electronics to sell. He says "thank you."

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony E. is 44 years old and is married with 8 children. He lives in Benin City, Nigeria. He buys second-hand car batteries, repairs them, and sells them to people who cannot afford new car batteries. The demand for second-hand batteries is high.

Anthony is requesting a loan of $1, 200 USD to meet the demands of his customers. He is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand car batteries to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel U. is 31 years old and is married. He lives in Benin City, Nigeria. He sells stationery and men's underwear. He learned this business in 3 years and started his own business in 2005.

Daniel needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more stationery and men's underwear to sell. He has been a LAPO client for the past 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more stationery and men's underwear to sell

loans.name: Limon

texts.en: Limon N. is a mother of five children. She was born in 1963. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan town. She has run her business for 15 years. Now Limon needs a loan of $1200 to buy more  foodstuffs to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
This group is called Laneh Kuru (Believe In God in Temne). Its members include Mohammed K. (the group leader), who sells tobacco; Isatu B., who sells clothes; Kadiatu M., who sells palm-oil and pepper (condiments); and Yeadu S..

These people are soliciting a loan of Le 1,800,000.00. This can help them a lot by allowing them to increase the size of their businesses with additional boxes of tobacco, palm-oi,l and pepper. Laneh Kuru's leader, Mohammed, is now 53. He was born in Sanda Loko, about 30 miles north of Makeni. He came to Makeni many years ago with his wife, who also sells groceries, because it is more populated and good for business. He has been in the tobacco business for over 20 years now and has 8 children.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tobacco, palm-oil, and pepper.

loans.name: Siradio

texts.fr:
Siradio K. is a young and very ambitious baker. He wants to build up his inventory of flour and increase his production. With his business, he founded a food shelter and participates in the fight against malnutrition in southern Senegal.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Siradio K. est un jeune boulanger trés ambitieux, il veut renforcer son stock de farine et augmenter sa production. Avec son activité, il a fondé un foyer et contibue à la lutte contre la malnutrition au sud Sénégal

loans.use: bakery

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria I. is 42 years old and is married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Victoria goes to the nearby villages in Benin City to buy yams and then sells the yams to retailers in the city. She learned this business in 4 years and she started her own business in 2003. She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years.

Victoria needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget Evgharevba is 40 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family where she sells food and groceries. Bridget learned this business from her mother in 2 years. She started her own business in 1999. She has been a LAPO client for the past 3 years.

Bridget needs a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more food and groceries. She expresses her gratitude to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food and groceries to sell

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana H. was born in 1980. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region, settled in the Absheron region. She has run this business for 4 years. 
Tarana is married and has one child. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy  foodstuffs to increase the income form her business.

loans.use: to buy  foodstuffs

loans.name: Ifoma

texts.en:
Ifoma I. is 27 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks. She learned this business from her elder sister in 6 years and she started her own business in 2003.

Ifoma needs a loan of $450 to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sokhrab

texts.en: Sokhrab B. is 29 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan town. He is married and has 2 children. He has been  in the taxi business for 3 years.  Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy  spare parts for his taxi and to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Omorefe

texts.en:
Omorefe F. is 30 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells traditional women's dresses called "wrappers." Omorefe learned this business from her mother. and started her own business in 2001. She is a LAPO client.

She needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more wrappers to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married, and lives with her husband. She sells gari (milled and fried cassava) in the local market. She has been doing so for the past 8 years. She travels to nearby villages in order to purchase more products and sell them to earn income. Lydia would like a loan to ensure that her prices remain stable. Farmers are about to enter the lean season, which would lead to a high price of cassava. Lydia believes that this loan would allow her to support her family and expand her business.

Lydia is a member of a group called Queens. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To more bags of “Gari” (milled and fried cassava)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married, and has four children. All of her children currently attend school. Rose sells raw rice and charcoal in her village, and has been doing so for 10 years. Rose would like to use the loan to purchase more bags of rice and charcoal, to increase her inventory and income to enable her children’s continued education. She believes that this loan would help her save for her children’s future.

Rose is a member of the group called Queens. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and charcoal

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married, and has five children. Three of them currently attend school. Florence walks to the northern part of Ghana to purchase products and used clothing from Kumasi. She would like to use the loan to purchase more bags of maize and rice to increase her inventory and avoid price hikes. She believes that this loan would help her save money to pay her children’s school fees and register as a member of the government’s health insurance plan.

Florence is a member of a group called Gospel Light. Members support one another in handling and repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari, maize and bales of used clothing

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old, and the mother of 6 children. All her children currently attend school. Grace treks to a nearby village to purchase products, and sells them in Kumasi, where she earns good sales and additional income to support her family. Grace would like to purchase more farm products to avoid price hikes as farmers enter the planting season. Grace wants to use the loan to purchase plantain, and cocoyam.

Grace is a member of a group called Isaiah. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To bunch of plantain and bags of cocoyam

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is 51 years old, and the widowed mother of four children. She has been selling farm produce in the local market for over 20 years. Due to a low income, she has not been able to give an education to all her children. Afua would like to request a loan in order to sustain her business, and finance an education for the youngest of her two children and ensure a bright future for them.

Afua is also a member of a group called Isaiah. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and plantain

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is married, and has two children. Both children currently attend school. Augustina sells smoked fish in her village, where she has many loyal customers, who purchase the fish or soup, popularly known as Light Soup in Ghana. Augustina would like a loan to restock and improve her business, as well as continue to finance her children’s education. Augustina would like to keep her prices set and avoid raising them, but the only way she can do this is with more capital.

Augustina is also a member of a group called Isaiah. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of smoked fish

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 40 years old, and the single mother of four children. She sells cosmetics in her village market. All of her children currently attend school. Charity would like a loan to continue to support her business, improve its customer base, and continue to pay for her children’s education. She believes that this loan is critical in sustaining her children’s future.

Charity is a member of the Anointed Ladies group, where members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice is 48 years old, and the single mother of three children. She sells and trades produce to local food vendors and restaurant owners. Rejoice is well known for her good character, and has a large consumer base. Unfortunately, Rejoice does not have enough capital to purchase bulk supplies, and must instead use credit. Rejoice would use her loan to improve her business capabilities and continue to support her family.

Rejoice is also part of the Humility Trust Group, where members support one another in repaying loans. Rejoice is featured in the group photo, and is wearing blue.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of supplies of onions.

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en:
Perpetual is 32 years old, married, and has four children. All of her children are currently attending school. Perpetual works as a trader who sells beans, groundnuts, millet, wheat, soya bean, and eggs. However, she believes that with increased capital, she can expand her business even further. Perpetual would use the loan to improve her business and help sustain her children’s education.

Perpetual also belongs to the King Jesus Trust Group, where members support one another in handling and repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of beans, groundnuts, millet, wheat, soya beans and eggs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 39 years old, and the mother of seven children. Rebecca is very industrious and works extremely hard to finance her children’s education and provide them with a better life. One of her children has already completed their senior year at high school. Rebecca works as a food vendor and sells rice porridge mixed with wheat, milk, and sugar. Rebecca would utilize a loan to purchase more rice and supplies to further increase her stock and expand her customer base.

Rebecca belongs to a community group called the King Jesus Trust Group. In this group, members support each other in handling and repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, wheat, sugar and cartons of milk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old, married, and has four children. All of her children currently attend school. Elizabeth sells vegetables such as beans, groundnuts, soya beans, and millet in the local market in Koforidua, Ghana. She currently does not have enough capital to sustain her business. Elizabeth would like a loan to increase her stock of current products and expand her customer base. She hopes to use her profits to sustain her family and continue to finance her children’s education.

Elizabeth belongs to a community group called El-Shadai. Members help one another by providing support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy more stock of beans, groundnuts, millet, wheat, soya beans.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty years old. She is the wife and mother of three children. Mary is a resourceful mother and she works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with a better life and better opportunities in future. All of Mary’s children currently attend school.

Mary sells corn dough and banku. Corn dough is a milled maize grain mixed with water and it is used to prepare local meals like banku and porridge. She prepares banku only on market days. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to increase her production of corn dough and banku. She belongs to the community group called ‘Yesu Nti’ (For the Sake of Christ) Trust Group. In this group, members support one another to pay back loans on time and follow through.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ehis

texts.en:
Ehis Erhhunmwonse is 35 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she runs a boutique. She learned how to sell men's clothing and shoes for 3 years before she started her own business in 1994. She is a dedicated and hard-working woman.

Ehis needs a loan for $1, 200 USD to buy more men's clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy  more men's clothing and shoes to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fairness Group

texts.en:
This group is called Fairrness. Its members include: Kadiatu K., who sells local produce/market food and Fatmata B., who sells articles. They both are asking for a loan of Le 2,000,000.00 to help them improve their businesses. These ladies have received previous loans from SMT and those loans have helped them a lot in increasing the sizes of their businesses and improving their family livelihoods. However, they still need more money to help them keep their businesses growing.

Kadiatu, who is the leader of this group, is now 48. She was born in Sanda but now lives wilth her husband in Makeni, together with their 4 children. Kadiatu`s husband is currently unemployed, thus she is the sole contributor to the family`s well-being. Kadiatu has been in the local produce business for over 25 years now.

loans.use: Buy more local produce to add onto their existing stock.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is an experienced trader in Koforidua market, Ghana. She is thirty one years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is pictured in her place because she was not available. Faustina has been selling hair products for the past eight years. The major product she currently trades in is weave-ons. ‘Doing good business requires good working capital’, she said. She wants to expand her shop to include additional types of weave-ons, hair creams, shampoo, and activators to make her store a one-stop shop for her customers. This is her dream, and it is because of this that she wants to pursue a loan. Faustina is a group member of the Blood of Jesus Trust Group. Members of this group help support one another in successfully paying back loans on time, and Faustina feels she is capable of repaying her loan as her business grows.

loans.use: To buy assorted weavons and hair creams, shampoo and activators.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret U. is 31 years old and is married. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She runs a patent store (pharmacy) in her community. She learned this business in 4 years.

She needs a loan for $875 USD to buy more medicine to sell to the people in her community. Margaret is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for treatment and for sale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is single and is a successful entrepreneur from Mukachevo. Tatyana sells perfumes in one of the busy local markets. She has been in this business for about 5 years and her products have been in stable demand over the years.

Presently, Tatyana has about $2,000 in inventory. She has a long-term view of her business development and is disciplined with all her business plans. All this has promoted the successful growth of her business. Moreover, Tatyana is not afraid of serious amounts of hard work which reveal her great entrepreneurial potential and allow her to make prompt loan repayments. Tatyana is requesting a 5,000 Grivna loan to increase the variety of perfumes sold in her store.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise sold in her perfume store

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy E. is 28 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells groceries and drinks. Joy learned this business in 3 years and started her own business in 1998. She has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

Joy needs a loan of $1,050 USD to buy more groceries and drinks to sell.She expresses her gratitude to all who have made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one child. He is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo. Alexander owns a business selling electronic appliances in the central city market. Alexander is an optimist and thanks God for making his business sustainable and successful. His cheerful personality and unique ability to guess customer preferences has earned him several loyal clients who return to his store time after time. Alexander has been a “Nadiya Ukraine” client for about 5 years. He has always been very prompt with loan repayment and has not had a single late payment.

Alexander has about $8,000 in inventory. However he would like to get a new loan to expand the assortment of goods for the summer season. He wants to purchase clothing of different sizes to meet his customer demands. Rich experience in retail, good location of his business in the busy central market and variety of merchandise has guaranteed stable income for Alexander from his store. The loan will not only help Alexander earn better profits and promote the growth of his business, but also give him an opportunity to save some money for personal purposes.

loans.use: To increase the stock of his electronics sales store

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma M. is the leader of the Masasi group. She is thirty years old and a mother of two boys and one girl aged nine, six and five respectively. Fatuma works in the retail business selling charcoal. Her business has been in operation for six years now, and she works from 7am to 7pm daily, earning a monthly profit of $250.

With this loan she hopes to increase her inventory and expand her sales to nearby markets. She has taken out four previous loans with Tujijenge before, and succesfully repaid all of them. Fatuma is in a group with 17 other borrowers. They will share the loan between them, and help pay it back together. Each member of the group is responsible for another, therefore ensuring payback of the loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory and expand sales.

loans.name: Azima

texts.en:
Azima is 49 years old, married and living in Kotorsko, near the town of Doboj. She has two children, both of whom are grown and married. Her husband works in construction, and is working in Slovenia for the summer. In the off season, he runs a car wash out of the family garage. Azima works on their farm to help support them, raising chicks and growing vegetables. This 1,000KM loan is thecouple's 3rd loan at Zene za Zene.

Azima wants to cultivate her land and given the increasing cost of fuel, needs this loan to buy fuel for her tractor and help run her business effectively. Depending on what she can afford, she may buy some additional chickens with any remaining funds.

loans.use: To buy fuel for  her tractor and to support her farm

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a savvy entrepreneur selling women’s clothing at one of the local markets in Kherson. In the twelve years she has had her business, she has gained valuable experience and insight into running a successful business. She sells a variety of clothing and is careful to offfer the best products she can. She watches what other vendors are selling then tries to distinguish her business by selling different products. Currently, Tatyana has about $10,000 in inventory.

This has been a big help to Tatyana and her family. She has already repaid 17 loans to Nadiya Ukraine. Tatyana has requested a loan of 3,000 Grivnas so that she can purchase additional inventory for her business. She would like to increase the selection of clothes sizes she has available and buy seasonal clothing in bulk for the busy summer season.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clothes store

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a married mother. She has been running a clothing business in the central market of Kherson for 3 years. She currently has over $10,000 invested in her business.

Irina is very disciplined and methodical. She is a good listener and always finds time for each of her clients even when there are many people at her kiosk. Irina has already repaid 11 loans to Nadiya Ukraine. Moreover, she has also received and paid back 2 loans to Kiva without any delinquencies. We believe Irina’s creativity and willingness to go an extra mile for her customers will guarantee success of her trade and prompt repayment of the current loan.

(Note: this is a short term “seasonal” loan that will be paid back in two months.)

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clothes store

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella O. is 43 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. Stella sells food and groceries. She has been in this business since 1982. She learned this business from her friend in 7 years.

Stella needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more food and groceries to sell. She says "thank you" to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more food and groceries to sell

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 47 years old and lives in Kotorsko, near the town of Doboj. She is married, and her husband does some seasonal construction work. He also earns a small disability pension from the military. The couple has 3 grown children.

This 1,000KM loan is Medina's second loan from Zene za Zene. Medina wants to buy chicks with this money, which she will fatten and eventually sell for a profit. She also plans to keep some of the chickens and use their eggs as a source of food for her self & her husband.

loans.use: To buy chicks for rearing

loans.name: Amani Hondogo Group

texts.en:
Suzo L. is married with 4 young boys. He is 46 and has been operating his business for 9 years. He works in agriculture, selling and raising cattle. He works from 5am to 6pm daily, earning a monthly profit of $150. Suzo has taken out 4 loans with Tujijenge previously. With this loan from Kiva, Suzo hopes to buy medicine for his cows and therefore increase the sales and profit of his business.

Suzo is the leader of his subgroup Amani Hondogo. In this group he will share the loan with four other entrepreneurs. They all operate in the food sector, selling eggs, vegetables and milk. Each member in the group is responsible for the other, and therefore they guarantee the full payback of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for his cows and to increase sales.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Daliborka

texts.en: Daliborka is a 30 year old woman from the small village of Tekucica.  She is not married, and supports herself by working as a sales clerk at a sneaker store in town.  She is requesting this first loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of 600KM to start a small business of her own.  She has found work as a typist, and already has many interested clients from the local college.  Daliboarka will use this money to buy a printer, and hopes this will be a good way to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To buy a printer and start a job as a typist

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen I. is 45 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Helen travels to Lagos and Onitsha to buy jewelry and traditional women's dresses, known as "wrappers," to sell to the people in her community. She learned this business in 2 years and she started her own business in 1982.

Helen needs a loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more wrappers and jewelry to sell. She has been a LAPO client for the past 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more women's dresses "wrappers" and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Šerifa

texts.en:
Šerifa is a 47 year old woman living in Kotorsko, near the town of Doboj. She is a widow and has 4 children. Her oldest three are married, while the youngest lives with her and is in 8th grade in the local school. She receives her husband’s pension, which gives her about 300KM monthly. This 1,000KM loan will be her 5th loan with Zene za Zene.

Šerifa has been able to maintain an extensive business. She works in agriculture, growing corn & fruit and also raising chickens. She sells her fruit, vegetables, and eggs in the village, and makes jams & marmalade to sell as well. She is able to keep some of the food she grows to feed herself & her youngest child. For this loan, Šerifa is requesting 1000KM to buy seeds for growing corn and also to purchase fuel for her tractor.

loans.use: To buy seeds to grow corn, and fuel for her tractor

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Janet S. is a single mother of three little girls. She operates a door-to-door clothes sales business and works from 8am to 5pm daily. She has operated this business since 2007 and earns a monthly income of $120.00. With this loan from Kiva, Janet hopes to employ another worker so she can expand her market reach and increase her sales. She also hopes to pay for her children's school fees with some of the proceeds.

Janet is the leader of the Tanzanite group. With her are six other entrepreneurs who will share this loan to help their businesses. These members hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loan, and thus guarantee full payback.

loans.use: To employ a worker and raise sales.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience Ogbemuudia is 39 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. Patience is a fashion designer by training. She studied fashion design for 3 years and she started her own business in 1995.

She need a loan of $875 USD to buy more clothes and tailoring materials to sell.

Patience is a LAPO client. She says "thank you" to all that made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy O. is 37 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. Mercy sells baby things. She learned this business in 4 months and started her own business in 2004. She has been a LAPO client for the past 7 years.

She is requesting a loan $875 USD to buy more baby things to sell.

loans.use: To buy more Baby things for sale

loans.name: Mema Group

texts.en:
Clement M. is married and a father of four. He operates a fruit a vegetable stand in Dar-Es-Salaam and works daily from 7am to 10pm. Clement has operated this business since 2000 and earns a monthly income of $140.00. With this loan from Kiva, Clement hopes to expand the size of his shop, offer a better variey of fruits and vegetables, and increase his monthly profit. With this added profit he wants to send his children to school.

Clement is the leader of the Mema group, which consists of 23 other members. All members will share in the loan according to their business needs. Furthermore, each member is responsible for the other, resulting in a guarantee of the entire loan's repayment. The group has succesfully repaid both of the loans they received from Tujijenge.

loans.use: To increase the size of his grocery store and help pay for school fees.

loans.name: Padagnassi

texts.fr:
Mme. Padagnassi A. has been a corn retailer since 1994. She was born on December 31, 1969, in Badou, in the Wawa prefecture in the Plateaux region of Togo. She is married to Mr. Akation A., who is retired. With three children dependent on her, she is an energetic woman who never gives up. Since starting her occupation, she has never diversified. She buys corn when it is plentiful and resells it when it is scarce, thereby turning a large profit. Currently, she has exhausted her stock, and requests her first loan to buy eleven sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse de maïs depuis 1994, madame A. Padagnassi est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Badou dans la préfecture de WAWA dans la région des plateaux. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur A. Akation qui est un retraité. Avec trois enfants à charge elle est une femme dynamique qui ne baisse jamais les bras. Depuis qu’elle a commencé son activité, elle ne l’a jamais diversifié. Elle achète le maïs en période d’abondance le stock et le revend en temps de pénurie. Ainsi elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfice. Actuellement ayant épuisé son stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 11 sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Purchase of eleven sacks of corn

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy E. is 36 years old, is married with 4 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She goes to the forest to buy timber and then takes the timber to the sawmill for processing into wood, which she sells to retailers.

Tracy is requesting a the loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more timber to sell. She learned this business in 18 months and started her own business in 2001. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Zouréhatou

texts.fr:
Mme. Zouréhatou M. was born in Kétao, a small village in the north of Togo. She is unmarried and has one dependent child. Since 1998, her occupation has been the purchase of yam tubers in villages where they are grown, and their sale at a market in Lomé. Without substantial funds, she must make frequent trips to restock, increasing her expenses. Therefore, she requests this, her first loan, to increase her stock by 100 yam tubers.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Célibataire avec un enfant à la charge, madame M. Zouréhatou est née à Kétao, un petit village situé au nord du TOGO. Depuis 1998 elle exerce une activité qui consiste en l’achat des tubercules d’igname dans les villages où se pratique la culture de ces denrées, et à leur vente dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. N’ayant pas de capital assez consistant elle est obligée de faire de fréquent voyage pour se ravitailler ce qui augmente ses charges. Elle sollicite donc ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de 100 tubercules d’igname.

loans.use: Purchase of 100 yam tubers

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Olga (pictured in the center) lives in a small community in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. Olga lives with her husband and two children, ages 7 and 2. She owns and manages her own business selling clothing, shoes, and undergarments as well as jewelery and bed sheets. Her business has continued to grow since she has had greater access to capital through the loans that Esperanza Internacional has given her. She has successfully paid off two loans already and would like to purchase more clothing, shoes, and undergarments to sell in her store with this next loan.

Olga has worked very hard to get to where she is today and will continue to do so in order to grow her business, support her family, and progress as an individual. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Olga herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and undergarments

loans.name: Las Mujeres Luchando Contra La Pobreza Group

texts.en:
Lucia M. is a middle-aged woman who came to Esperanza in search of her first loan. She has begun a small “colmadito”, or store that sells staple foods and accessories. However, she is lacking adequate capital to buy enough inventory for the store. The money from this loan will go towards purchasing cooking oil, rice, sugar, and crackers. Lucia said that she hopes to continue to grow her business, so that she will be able to help support her two grown children (23 and 25) to attend college. When she is not working, Lucia enjoys attending her local church several times a week.

Lucia Matinez is the leader of the 10 person micro-bank, Las Mujeres Luchando Contra La Pobreza, which means, The Women Fighting Against Poverty. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. One of the other women in the group has runs a small salon, one sells vegetables in the street, and several of the others sell clothing to in the streets and markets of Puerto Plata.

On behalf of Lucia, the Mujeres Luchando group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oils, sugar, and vegetables.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee is a very happy woman, full with enthusiasm. She works in harvest fields and breeds animals; these activities allow her to sustain her home.

Haydee uses all the money she earns to buy cattle as it gives her milk which she uses to make cheese and sell it at the different markets of the region.

Haydee would like to buy more cows and other animals to shepherd during the afternoons. In the future, she would also like to sell meat.

Haydee now turns to you so she can buy a small sheep, which will allow her to make her business grow little by little. Haydee needs your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee es una mujer alegre y con mucho entusiasmo, trabaja en sus terrenos de cultivo y en la crianza de animales, estas actividades le ayudan a mantener su hogar.

Todo su dinero lo utiliza en la compra de vacunos, los que le brindan la leche necesaria para que pueda preparar quesos y venderlos en la feria más cercana a su localidad.

Haydee desea adquirir una mayor cantidad de vacas y otros animales que pueda pastear por las tardes y en un futuro cercano poder vender también carne.

Recurre a usted para que le ayuden en la compra de una pequeña oveja y luego ir aumentando poco a poco. Haydee necesita de tu apoyo.

loans.use: Haydee now turns to you so she can buy a small sheep, which will allow her to make her business grow little by little

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl is a man dedicated to his work as a farmer and along with his wife they pay for their children’s expenses. They also raise cattle and take them to graze in the pastures. Unfortunately one of their daughters was deceived and abandoned by her husband, and now her parents not only have to care for their children, but also for two grandchildren. Their adult daughters contribute to the maintenance of the household, but raising livestock is the principal source of income for their family. They have gone through many sad times together, but they have left those behind and keep working hard. Now they would like to buy new and better cattle in order to improve the breed of their animals. For this reason they are requesting a loan and they are confident in your hearts, and that you can help support them in moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Raúl es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo como agricultor y junto a su esposa solventan los gastos de sus hijos. Ellos se dedican también a pastear y criar vacas. Lamentablemente una de sus hijas fue engañada y abandonada por su pareja, entonces, estos padres no sólo tienen que mantener a sus hijos, sino también a dos nietos. Sus hijas adultas colaboran con el sostén del hogar, pero es básicamente la ganadería, el principal sustento de esta familia. Juntos han pasado muchas penas, pero han dejado atrás éstas y siguen esforzándose, ahora ellos desean adquirir nuevas y mejores vacas para mejorar la raza de sus animales. Por esta razón solicitan este préstamo, confiando en su corazón, que ustedes puedan apoyarlos a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Buy new cattle in order to improve the breed of their animals and improve their family situation

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Ayaovi D. A. was born in Lomé on December 25, 1958. he is married and has one dependent. He lives with his wife Essi Elisabeth Amevor, who sells basic household goods. He lives in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. His primary occupation is the sale of children’s clothing. Typically, this sort of occupation is performed by women. This, the first loan he is requesting, will allow him to buy five dozen outfits in order to replenish his stock and attract more clients.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 25 décembre 1958 à Lomé, monsieur D. A. Ayaovi est un homme marié qui a une personne à charge. Il vit avec sa femme AMEVOR Essi Elisabeth qui est une revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités. Il réside dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il a pour activité principale la vente des habits pour enfant. Généralement ce genre d’activité est exercé par les femmes. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter cinq douzaines d’habits afin de refaire son stock et attirer plus de clients.

loans.use: Purchase of five dozen outfits

loans.name: Hernán Ricardo

texts.es:
Hernán is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his young daughters, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly. He would need capital of 500 soles ($175), and at the moment he does not have that much money and he is requesting this loan. Hernán hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty. Help Hernán improve his livestock’s breed.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hernán es un padre muy amoroso y pendiente de las necesidades de sus pequeñas hijas, quienes son su adoración. Él se dedica a criar ganado, todas las mañanas sale a pastear a sus animales por los alrededores. Su anhelo es mejorar la calidad de sus animales, pero para ello tendría que comprar ganados de mejor raza, estos animales son sumamente costosos y tendría que tener un capital de 500 soles, y en estos momentos él no cuenta con esta cantidad, por ello solicita este préstamo. Hernán tiene la esperanza de que confíen en su trabajo y honestidad. Ayuda a Hernán a mejorar la raza de su ganado.

loans.use: Buy animals of a better breed in order to improve the quality of his livestock

loans.name: Rafael Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés is a young man that at 30 years of age desires to continue supporting his parents, and has remained single to do it. His goal is to save for himself and then to form his own family. Because of this, from his youth he has always helped his parents in the agricultural work and, thanks to this, he could obtain a technical career to which he is dedicated in the city, but without abandoning his crops. Every 15 days he returns to the fields to supervise his lands and with the pledge of his father, as the photo shows, all turns out well. Nevertheless, a difficulty exists. The high costs of fertilizer so that his crop produces a high percentage yield needs to be paid and this family does not have the means to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Andrés es un joven que a sus 30 años desea seguir apoyando a sus padres, y por ahora permanecer soltero para hacerlo, su meta es ahorrar para sí, y luego formar su propia familia. Por ello, desde joven ayudó siempre a sus padres en las labores agrícolas y gracias a esto pudo obtener una carrera técnica a la cual se dedica en la ciudad, pero sin abandonar sus cultivos, cada 15 días regresa al campo para supervisar sus tierras y con el empeño de su padre, como lo muestra la foto, todo sale muy bien. Sin embargo, existe una dificultad, los altos costos de los abonos, para que su cosecha produzca en un alto porcentaje necesita ser abonada y esta familia no cuenta con los medios para comprarlos.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the yield of his crops.

loans.name: Kokou Edi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou Edi Kekpedou-Blewoussi was born in Kpalimé on May 15, 1976. His wife is a retailer. He has opened a photocopying center in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. His business is located next to a middle school and serves the photocopying needs of many students.

This is the first loan he is requesting. It will allow him to buy twelve boxes of reams of paper, and to begin selling cards to recharge mobile phones.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur KEKPEDOU-BLEWOUSSI Kokou Edi est né le 15 mai 1976 à Kpalimé. Il s’est marié à une femme revendeuse. Il a ouvert un centre de photocopie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Son centre est situé à coté d’un collège et il reçoit beaucoup d’élèves qui font la photocopie.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 cartons de rames et de débuter la vente de cartes de recharge.

loans.use: Purchase of paper and mobile phone cards

loans.name: Yawogan Sekonou

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawogan Sekonou F. was born in Lomé on May 10, 1985. He is a bachelor whose occupation is the sale of electronics in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. He began this occupation in 2006 and gets his merchandise at the autonomous port of Lomé. He restocks monthly.

This, the first loan that he is requesting, will allow him to purchase five TVs, ten radios and five DVD players. All the appliances he wishes to buy are second-hand and will be bought at relatively low prices, allowing him to gain considerable income.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 10 mai 1985 à Lomé, monsieur F. Yawogan Sekonou est un célibataire qui a pour activité la vente des appareils électroniques dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Il a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2006 et s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé. Sa fréquence d’approvisionnement est mensuelle.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 postes téléviseurs, 10 postes de radio et 5 lecteurs de DVD ; tous ces appareils qu’il désire acheter sont des appareils d’occasion et sont achetés à un prix relativement bas ce qui lui permet de tirer assez de revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of electronics

loans.name: Ángel Luis

texts.es:
Ángel is a young farmer and father of a beautiful little girl. He is very aware that his work will provide a future for his family. They currently live in a rented house and every month Ángel must take money from the little he makes in order to pay the rent. Ángel wakes up every day with the desire to be able to buy his own land where he could build a house of his own and give his family the satisfaction of having, at last, a home of their own. But for now, this dream is far away. Redoubling his efforts in the fields day after day, Ángel counts on improving his crops and making better profits, but he does not have the money to purchase the supplies necessary for his land, such as the fertilizer, insecticides and everything he needs in order to care for and obtain a good harvest. Thus this young father requests of you a loan of 300 soles ($125) that will be able to cover the costs of purchasing these farming items.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel es un joven agricultor y padre de una hermosa niña, en sus fuerzas está el porvenir de su familia, y él sabe eso muy bien. Actualmente viven en una casa alquilada, y cada mes tiene que sacar de sus pocas ganancias, una cantidad para pagar la renta. Ángel se despierta cada día con el anhelo de poder comprar un terreno para construir su casa y darle la satisfacción a su familia de tener, por fin, una casa propia, pero por ahora, este sueño es muy lejano. Redoblando fuerzas en el campo día a día Ángel confía en mejorar sus cosechas y conseguir mayores ganancias, pero no cuenta con el dinero para comprar los insumos necesarios para su tierra, como el abono, los insecticidas y todo aquello que se requiere para cuidar y procurar una cosecha satisfactoria. Así es que, este joven padre, recurre a usted para solicitar un préstamo de 300 soles que puedan cubrir la compra de estos elementos de cultivo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies necessary for farming in order to obtain a better harvest

loans.name: Koffi Pierre

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Pierre A. was born on December 31st, 1954 in Lomé. He is married and the father of four. After retiring in 1997, he opened a general store in Lomé. In his store, ETS BORO, he is currently having trouble maintaining adequate stock of supplies (rice, oil, tomatoes…) and is requesting this first loan to buy 10 sacks of rice, 14 cans of oil, 4 cases of canned tomatoes, and 2 cases of soap.

This way, he will have a more attractive stock, which will increase sales.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Après sa retraite en 1997, monsieur A. Koffi Pierre né le 31 décembre 1954 à Lomé, marié et père de quatre enfants a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités et de boisson à Lomé. Dans son magasin ETS BORO, il a actuellement un problème lié à l’insuffisance de stock de vivres (riz, huile, tomates, …) et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 14 bidons d’huile, 4 cartons de tomates en boîte et 2 cartons de savons).

Ainsi il aura un stock plus attrayant pour pouvoir mieux vendre.

loans.use: Purchase of basic supplies

loans.name: Kwanba Martine

texts.fr:
Miss Kwanba Martine S. was born on October 10th, 1975 in Lomé. She is divorced and has three children. Her primary activity is clothing sales in the Adidogomé area of Lomé. She is a traveling saleswoman who sells from one neighborhood to the next, covering on average 10 kilometers per day on foot.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase four clothing bundles.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle S. Kwanba Martine est née le 10 octobre 1975 à Lomé. Elle a trois enfants et est une femme divorcée. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de friperie dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Elle est une revendeuse ambulant qui vend de quartier en quartier et parcourt en moyenne une distance de 10 Km à pieds par jour.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 4 ballots de friperie.

loans.use: Purchase of 4 clothing bundles

loans.name: Dodji Yaovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Dodji Yaovi A., born December 24th, 1978, is married and the father of three. He opened BAR LABOR and sells drinks and basic supplies in the Adidogomé area of Lomé. His wife Afi DOKOU often helps out, serving clients when the establishment is crowded. This bar was only opened last year, but there are many clients.

This first loan that Mr. A. is requesting will allow him to increase his inventory of basic supplies, such as 4 cases of soap, 6 cases of canned goods and 6 sacks of rice.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Dodji Yaovi né le 24 décembre 1978 est marié et est père de 3 enfants. Il a ouvert le BAR LABOR et vend des boissons et des produits de premières nécessités dans son quartier de résidence Adidogomé à Lomé. Il est souvent aidé par sa femme DOKOU Afi qui sert les clients en cas d’affluence. Ce bar a été ouvert l’année passée seulement mais accueille beaucoup de clients.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra de renforcer la partie des produits de premières nécessites tels que 4 cartons de savons, 6 cartons de boîtes de conserve et 6 sacs de riz.

loans.use: Purchase of basic supplies

loans.name: Mouhamadou

texts.fr:
Mouhamadou Diakhaté is a young man who has specialized in business since he quit his studies. He is single and without children and lives in Medina Falls neighborhood in Thies. He manages a hardware store, and his clientele is made up of masons from his neighborhood. With this loan, he plans to buy goods to build up his inventory and increase his income.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

mouhamadou diakhaté est un jeune qui est spécialisé dans le commerce depuis qu'il a abandonné les études .il est célibataire sans enfants et réside au quartier medina fall de thies .il gère une quincaillerie et sa clientèle est composée des maçons de son quartier.avec ce pret il compte acheter des marchandises pour renforcer son stock et améliorer ses revenus

loans.use: purchase of hardware goods

loans.name: Bilibark

texts.fr:
Mr. Bilibark B. was born on August 7th, 1981 in Lomé. He is single and a young man who is working hard to make a future for himself. In 2005, he started a business selling charcoal in his area. Thanks to his considerable energy, he was able to become a wholesaler for numerous charcoal sellers in the Adidogomé market.

His goal is to expand his clientele, and to do so he would like to increase his stock. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to buy 50 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur B. Bilibark est né le 07 août 1981 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et est un jeune qui se bat beaucoup pour son avenir. En 2005, il a commencé le commerce de vente de charbon de bois dans son quartier. Ayant assez d’énergie il est devenu grossiste pour bon nombres de revendeuses de charbons du marché d’Adidogomé.

Ayant pour objectif d’étendre sa clientèle, elle désire augmenter son stock et sollicite à cet effet ce premier crédit pour acheter 50 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use: Purchase of 50 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariama S. is 38 years old with three children. She was born in Atakpamé, but currently lives in Lomé. The area where she lives is somewhat far from the center of town, which makes it difficult for her to do get certain grocery items. Seven years ago, she had the idea to open a general grocery store to serve her area. This fulfilled a need in her local area, which is demonstrated by her increasing clientele.

This first loan will allow her to increase her stock of various general food products.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, madame S. Mariama est née à Atakpamé mais réside actuellement à Lomé. Son quartier de résidence est assez éloigné du centre ville ce qui fait que l’approvisionnement en divers produits d’alimentation général lui est difficile. Il y a 7ans de cela qu’elle a eu l’idée de desservir son quartier en y implantant une boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle a répondu au besoin de son milieu ce qui est prouvé par une clientèle grandissante.

Ce premier crédit lui servira d’augmenter son stock en divers produits pour alimentation générale.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of staples and basic products for her store.

loans.name: Dodjiko

texts.fr:
Born in Amou-oblo on December 31, 1966, Ms. Dodjiko M. is a widow with two children living in Lomé. She is a dressmaker in Agoè, a district in Lomé, where she currently lives. She has always made custom clothing. When her husband passed away and she had to manage the household expenses on her own, she had the idea of making clothes with the traditional fabric that she would buy at the market in Lomé. She sells the clothing at the market or in her workshop where she puts them on display. She is taking out the second loan to buy 20 pieces of fabric because these clothes are very valued and demand for them has increased.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Amou-oblo le 31 décembre 1966, madame M. Dodjiko, veuve avec deux enfants à la charge vit à la Lomé. Elle est couturière à Agoè, un quartier de Lomé où elle vit. Elle a toujours confectionné les vêtements sur commande. Mais à la mort de son mari où elle doit faire face seule aux charges de sa famille, elle a eu l’idée de confectionner des habits avec des tissus pagnes qu’elle achète au grand marché de Lomé. Elle les revend ensuite dans son atelier où elle fait une exposition, et au grand marché. Elle avait pris un premier crédit qui l’a aidé dans son innovation. Elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes car ses vêtements sont très appréciés et la demande a augmentée

loans.use: Buy 20 pieces of traditional fabric

loans.name: Ayawa Béatrice

texts.fr:
Born in 1969 in Zanguéra, a suburb of Lomé, Mrs. Ayawa Béatrice A. is married and the mother of three children. While she has never gone to school, she is very energetic and in 2001 began a business selling general groceries. She buys in bulk and sells the items at retail price. Due to her drive, her business has experienced a remarkable growth and increase in demand. She has already taken out two loans, which she repaid successfully. This third loan will also be used to increase her supply.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Zanguéra, un banlieu de Lomé, madame A. Ayawa Béatrice est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle n’a jamais été à l’école mais très dynamique elle s’est lancée depuis 2001 dans le commerce de divers produits d’alimentation générale. Elle achète en gros et revend en détail. Son commerce a connu une croissance très remarquable et la demande aussi à cause de son dynamisme. Ainsi elle a déjà pris deux crédits qu’elle a très bien payés. Ce troisième crédit est aussi destiné à augmenter son stock.

loans.use: Increase stock of general grocery products

loans.name: Womama Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Womama Afi A. was born in a small village named Wouévé in Togo. She is married and the mother of two children. She is a very clever business person, who knew to identify the needs of her area before starting her business. Since 2005 she has lived in a new district where the buildings are in the middle of construction. Thus, she opened a hardware shop in this district to satisfy the needs of the contractors, who previously were forced to buy the items further away. Mrs. A. has made progress in her business as her supply is no longer enough to meet the demand. She would like to increase her stock. That is why she is taking out this first loan.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Womama Afi est née dans un petit village, Wouévé au TOGO. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. C’est une commerçante très astucieuse qui a su détecter les besoins de son milieu avant de mettre sur pied son commerce. Elle vit depuis 2005 dans un nouveau quartier où les bâtiments sont en pleine construction. Elle a alors ouvert une boutique de quincailleries dans ce quartier pour satisfaire les entrepreneurs qui étaient obligés d’aller plus loin pour payer les articles dont ils ont besoin. Madame A. a eu gain de cause car aujourd’hui son stock est insuffisant pour répondre aux demandes. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier crédit

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Lelis Inocenta

texts.es:
Lelis is a very hard-working woman who over the years has forged her future with her own hands, as she is an expert seamstress. In all this time she has maintained her home with this work. She has three children, all of whom are adults now and all demonstrate the good upbringing that their mother gave them. For Lelis the work continues, she does not want to give up knitting and now depends on it for income. She is such a creative and detail-oriented woman that her garments are works of art. At the same time, while times change and the world advances, Lelis wants to work on new and different garments in order to get the attention of her customers. Lelis wants to buy new knitting supplies and different types of wool. This woman truly has woven her own future with her own hands.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lelis es una mujer muy trabajadora que durante años ha forjado su futuro con sus propias manos, ya que ella es una experta tejedora. En todo este tiempo ha mantenido su hogar con este trabajo, ella tiene tres hijos, los cuales ahora ya son mayores y todos demuestran la buena crianza que les dio su madre. Para Lelis el trabajo continúa, ella no quiere dejar de tejer y ahora depende su sustento de eso. Es una mujer tan creativa y detallista que sus prendas son una obra de arte. Pero así como los tiempos cambian y el mundo avanza, Lelis quiere también realizar nuevas y novedosas prendas, para llamar la atención de sus clientes. Lelis desea comprar nuevos implementos de tejido y diferentes tipos de lana. Esta mujer verdaderamente a teje con sus propias manos su futuro. Apóyala.

loans.use: Purchase new supplies and wool in order to continue knitting her beautiful garments

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
The mother of Milagros is a nurse. It was from this that the idea arose to start a pharmacy. Milagros takes advantage of the fact that she has to remain at home with her small son, to take charge of the pharmacy. She has tended the business for 3 years.

The loan that she has requested will serve to buy the medicines that she offers in the pharmacy.

Milagros would like the business to grow more.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La mamá de Milagros es enfermera, fue así que surgió la idea de poner una farmacia. Milagros aprovecha que tiene que quedarse en casa, por su hijo pequeño, para hacerse cargo de la farmacia. Ella atiende allí desde hace 3 años.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar los medicamentos que ofrece en la farmacia.

A Milagros le gustaría que el negocio crezca más.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es:
Filomeno has had a store in his house for 6 years. Previously it was dedicated only to the sale of beverages. Then he wanted to grow his business, so he began offering delicacies and basic foods.

Filomeno is a bricklayer and, when some opportunity for work is presented, he does not doubt that he will be going to work.

The loan that he has requested will serve to supply the store.

He would like the business to grow more so that he will be able to fix his house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomeno tiene una tienda en su casa desde hace 6 años. Antes solo se dedicaba a la venta de bebidas. Luego fue haciendo crecer su negocio hasta ofrecer golosinas y alimentos de primera necesidad.

Filomeno es albañil, por lo que cuando se presenta alguna oportunidad de trabajo, él no duda en ir a laborar.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para surtir más la tienda.

Él quisiera que su negocio crezca más y así poder arreglar su casa.

loans.use: To supply his store with products for sale: basic foods, beverages and delicacies.

loans.name: Rut

texts.es:
Rut sells food every night outside her house. For some years, the people that went to her house confused their facade with a carbonated water store, and they knocked on the door asking her for these products. So it was decided to put a business outside of her house. In the summer she began to sell fruit ‘chupetes’ (a frozen confection). In winter sells foods and desserts. Already she has been dedicated to this activity for 4 years.

Every day she sets up her tables and sells from 6 in the afternoon to 10 at night.

The loan that she has requested will serve to buy her gas stove and kitchen utensils.

She would like to have a restaurant or a poultry shop in a business district.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Rut vende comida todas las noches afuera de su casa. Hace algunos años, la gente que iba por su casa confundía su fachada con una tienda de gaseosas, por lo que le tocaban la puerta pidiéndole estos productos. Fue así que decidió poner un negocio afuera de su casa. En verano empezó a vender chupetes de frutas. En invierno vende comida y postres. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esta actividad.

Todos los días saca sus mesas y vende desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar su cocina a gas y los utensilios de cocina.

A ella le gustaría tener un restaurante o una pollería en una zona comercial.

loans.use: To buy a gas stove and kitchen utensils for her food business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for EDAPROSPO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Flora Zenaida

texts.es:
Mrs. Zenaida is a woman with a lot of experience in the area of sales. Over 30 years ago she opened a general store in her own home, and every day has been better than the last. When she decided to open this business, she was motivated by the need to support her household. She still has a son who needs to finish his studies at the university. After so many years, she keeps struggling with the market, and now that competition is greater Zenaida does not want to be left behind. She needs to purchase new merchandise for her general store. Help her keep forging ahead for her future and that of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Zenaida es una mujer D. mucha trayectoria en el ámbito D. las ventas, hace más D. 30 años abrió una bodega en su propia casa, cada día ha sido mejor que el otro. Cuando ella decidió abrir este negocio su motivación era el sostenimiento D. su hogar. Ahora aún tiene un hijo que debe terminar sus estudios en la universidad. Después D. tantos años, ella sigue luchando con el mercado, ya que la competencia cada día es mayor, por ello, Zenaida no se quiere quedar atrás, necesita comprar nueva mercadería para su bodega, ayúdale para siga forjando su futuro y el D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy new merchandise to supply her general store with new products

loans.name: Gisella

texts.es:
Gisella’s husband makes clothes. For this reason Gisella is dedicated to the sale of the clothes to her friends and acquaintances. She also takes orders for clothes that her husband fills.

In addition, Gisella has sold cosmetics from a catalog for 5 years.

The loans that she has received have served to pay in advance for the cosmetics that she offers so that she has available stock of products.

She would like to have a store where she could sell a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Gisella confecciona ropa, por lo que Gisella se dedica a ofrecer la ropa a sus amistades y conocidos. También recibe pedidos de ropa y su esposo los fabrica.

Además, Gisella vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 5 años.
